translated: By due to the absence of a reason for certainty, the absence of a reason for certainty is intended.

analyzed: sattva prāptim puraskṛtya na asti iti pratyaya udayāt
translated: Or, another reading is possible: due to the arising of the notion of non-existence, having placed the attainment of existence in the forefront.

analyzed: sadā sattvam prapañcasya sāṅkhyāḥ tu pratipedire
translated: The Sāṃkhyas maintain that the existence of the world is always.

analyzed: etad virodhi sattva ekānta vādi kāpila matam āha sattva prāptim iti
translated: The opinion of Kapila, who maintains the extreme doctrine that is contrary to this, is stated: The attainment of existence, etc.

analyzed: prasakti pūrvaka tvāt niṣedhasya upajīvya tvāt sattva pratītiḥ prabalā
translated: Since negation is preceded by affirmation, and since the cognition of existence is stronger because it is what is relied upon,

analyzed: tat sadā sattvam eva prapañcasya  na asti iti tu abhivyakti abhāva parā pratītiḥ iti eteṣām āśayaḥ
translated: their intention is that the existence of the world is always.🔽But the cognition that it does not exist is directed towards the absence of manifestation.

analyzed: sat asat pratyaya prāpta viruddha dvandva saṅkaṭe
translated: In the dilemma of the contradiction of the two opposed properties of existence and non-existence, which are attained by the cognition,

analyzed: virodha parihāra artham sattva asata tva aṃśa bhaṅgataḥ
translated: in order to remove the contradiction, by the division into the part that exists and the part that does not exist,

analyzed: sat asadbhyām anirvācyam prapañcam kecid ūcire
translated: some have said that the world is inexpressible by both existence and non-existence.

analyzed: mata dvaya pratyanīkam māyā vādinām matam āha sat asat iti
translated: The opinion of the Mādhyamikas, which is contrary to both of those two opinions, is stated: The attainment of existence and non-existence, etc.

analyzed: pratīti balāt sattva asattva rūpa viruddha dharma dvaya āpatti rūpa saṅkaṭe prasakte viruddhayoḥ aikādhikaraṇya anupapatti balāt sattvam asattvam
translated: When there is the dilemma in the form of the attainment of the two opposed properties of existence and non-existence due to the force of cognition, because of the impossibility of the co-existence of the two opposed properties, existence and non-existence

original: ca viruddhaṃ dharmadvayaṃ parityajya na sat nāpyasaditi sadasadanirvacaniyaṃ prapañca
analyzed: ca viruddham dharma dvayam parityajya na sat na api asat iti sat asat anirvacaniyam prapañca
translated: are abandoned, and the world is said to be neither existent nor non-existent, inexpressible as either existent or non-existent.

analyzed: nirvacanti śāṅkarāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The followers of Sankara explain it thus.

original: sattvāsattve vibhāgena deśakālādibhedataḥ /🔽ghaṭāderiti manvānā vyavasthāmapare jaguḥ // //
analyzed: sattva asattve vibhāgena deśa kāla ādi bhedataḥ  ghaṭa ādeḥ iti manvānāḥ vyavasthām apare jaguḥ
translated: Some others have said that there is a restriction of the existence and non-existence of the pot etc. in accordance with the division of space, time etc.

analyzed: naiyāyika ādīnām pakṣam āha sat asat tve iti
translated: The Naiyāyikas and others have said that there is a restriction of the existence and non-existence of the pot etc. in accordance with the division of space, time etc.

analyzed: vibhāgena iti tṛtīya itthambhāve
translated: The division is in the third sense.

original: vibhaktadeśakālādiviśeṣataḥ sattvamasattvaṃ ca pratītaṃ vyavasthitaṃ ghaṭāderghaṭata eveti bhāvo 'mīṣām // //
analyzed: vibhakta deśa kāla ādi viśeṣataḥ sattvam asattvam ca pratītam vyavasthitam ghaṭa ādeḥ ghaṭataḥ eva iti bhāvaḥ mīṣām  /
translated: The idea of these people is that the existence and non-existence are well-established as being perceived in the pot etc. in accordance with the division of space, time etc. which are specific to the pot itself.

analyzed: tat evam vādi sammardāt saṃśaye samupasthite
translated: Thus, when doubt has arisen due to the clash of arguments of the disputants,

analyzed: nirṇayaḥ kriyate tatra mīmāṃsaka matena tu
translated: a decision is made there according to the Mīmāṃsaka's view.

analyzed: tat evam iti
translated: Thus - in this way.

analyzed: vādi saṃmarda tva ādi vivādāt
translated: Due to the clash of arguments of the disputants.

analyzed: vipratipatteḥ iti yāvat
translated: That is, due to disagreement.

analyzed: vipratipatteḥ sandeha udayāt sandigdha artha nirṇayāya vicāraḥ upacikramiṣitaḥ
translated: Because of the arising of doubt due to disagreement, the inquiry is undertaken for the determination of the doubtful meaning.

original: tatra pakṣāntarāṇāṃ sadoṣatvapratipādanapūrvakaṃ sopādhikasattvāsattvapakṣo mīmāṃsakābhimato nirṇīyate sadyuktyeti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tatra pakṣa antarāṇām sa doṣa tva pratipādana pūrvakam sopādhika sattva asattva pakṣaḥ mīmāṃsaka abhimataḥ nirṇīyate sat yuktyā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: There, after establishing the faults of the other positions, the position of the Mīmāṃsakas, which is based on the existence and non-existence with a reason, is determined along with the proper arguments. This is the idea.

analyzed: kriyate iti vartamāna vyapadeśaḥ tad sāmīpyāt
translated: The use of the present tense in is made is due to proximity to the present time.

analyzed: pratijñā ca iyam śrotṛ buddhi samādhi arthā  ghaṭa svarūpe nāstitvam astitvam yadi abūbudhat
translated: This is the promise, for the sake of the concentration of the minds of the listeners.🔽If one understood the non-existence and existence of the nature of a pot,

analyzed: syāt eva yugapad sattvam asattvam ca ghaṭa ādiṣu
translated: then existence and non-existence would occur simultaneously in pots and so on.🔽Because of this, the thoughts of existence and non-existence due to differences in place, time, and condition,

analyzed: idānīm idam atra asti na asti iti evaṃvidhā yatas  deśa kāla daśā bhedāt asti na asti iti naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: such as this exists here now and this does not exist, do not occur.

analyzed: atas deśa ādi bhedena sat asat tvam ghaṭa ādiṣu  vyavasthitam nirasta tva asyāḥ
translated: Therefore, the existence and non-existence of pots and so on are established by differences in place and so on.

analyzed: dvādasya iha na sambhavaḥ
translated: The non-existence of this is refuted here, and its non-existence is not possible.

analyzed: tatra nirupādhika sattva asattva samuccaya pakṣa nirasanena siddhāntaḥ samanuvarṇyate ghaṭa sva rūpā etyādinā śloka trayeṇa
translated: There, the conclusion is described by the three verses beginning with the nature of a pot, by refuting the position of the combination of unqualified existence and non-existence.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ ghaṭa svarūpe nāstitvam pratīyamānam eva
translated: The meaning is this: The non-existence of the nature of a pot, which is perceived,

analyzed: na asti iti pratītiḥ eva iti yāvat
translated: is just the perception that it does not exist.

original: yadyastitvamapi tasya pratyapādayiṣyat /🔽yadvā pratītiḥ sattvamasattvaṃ ca nirūpādhi yadi pratyapādayiṣyat /
analyzed: yadi astitvam api tasya pratyapādayiṣyat  yat vā pratītiḥ sattvam asattvam ca yadi pratyapādayiṣyat
translated: If one would have established its existence as well,🔽or if the perception would have established both existence and non-existence with qualifications,

analyzed: tarhi sat asat tva samuccayaḥ bhyupāgaṃsyata
translated: then one would have accepted the combination of existence and non-existence.

analyzed: na ca evam
translated: But it is not so.

analyzed: kintu kiñcid deśa kāla avasthā ādi viśeṣeṇa sattvam
translated: But existence with a particular place, time, state, etc.

analyzed: anya deśa ādi aupādhikam asattvam eva ca pratipādayanti pratītayaḥ
translated: And the cognitions indicate that non-existence in other places, etc. is only due to superimposition.

analyzed: atas deśa ādi bhedataḥ sat asat tve vyavasthite ghaṭa ādau
translated: Therefore, in a pot, etc., existence and non-existence are established according to the difference of place, etc.

analyzed: tat vādasya anya vādasya bādhā ādi doṣa dūṣita tvāt na sambhavaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the doctrine of the Jains, being tainted by the faults of contradiction, etc., is not possible.

original: nirastasyādvādasyeti pāṭhaḥ sambhāvyate /🔽tadāyamarthaḥ nirastasya vyāghātabādhitasya syādvādasya syādasti /
analyzed: nirastasya advādasya iti pāṭhaḥ sambhāvyate  tadā ayam arthaḥ nirastasya vyāghāta bādhitasya syādvādasya syāt asti
translated: The reading of the refuted doctrine is possible.🔽This is the meaning: The doctrine of the Jains, which is refuted by contradiction, may be it exists,

analyzed: syāt nā asti iti jainānām anaikāntya vādasya na sambhavaḥ iti
translated: it does not exist, it both exists and does not exist. The doctrine of non-absolutism of the Jains is not possible.

analyzed: atra ca naiyāyika ādi matam
translated: And here is the opinion of the Naiyāyikas, etc.

original: tataḥ siddhānte viśeṣaśca śatadūṣaṇyāṃ vyavriyata ṣaṣṭitame vāde śrīmannigamāntācāryacaraṇaiḥ /
analyzed: tatas siddhānte viśeṣaḥ ca śatadūṣaṇyām vyavriyata ṣaṣṭitame vāde śrīmat nigama anta ācārya caraṇaiḥ
translated: Therefore, the difference in the conclusion and the refutation of a hundred faults are explained in the sixty-fourth debate by the venerable Nigamanta Ācārya.

analyzed: yathā upādhi bhedāt ubhaya vyavasthā iti pakṣam adūra viprakarṣāt parigṛhṇīmahe
translated: As we accept the view that both are established due to the difference of superimposition, because it is not far removed.

analyzed: upādhi bhedaḥ tu sva ātmanā sattvam
translated: But the difference of superimposition is existence by one's own nature.

analyzed: anya ātmanā asattvam
translated: Non-existence by another's nature.

analyzed: sva kāle sattvam
translated: Existence at one's own time.

analyzed: anya kāle punar asattvam
translated: Non-existence again at another time.

analyzed: tathā sva deśe sattvam
translated: Similarly, existence in one's own place.

analyzed: anya deśe punar asattvam iti
translated: Non-existence, on the other hand, is in another place.

original: iha tādātmyaṃ saṃsargo vā sattvamiti vyapadiśyate /
analyzed: iha tādātmyam saṃsargaḥ vā sattvam iti vyapadiśyate
translated: Here, identity or association is called existence.

analyzed: tad viruddha veṣeṇa vastuni eva asat vyapadeśaḥ
translated: The designation of non-existence to an existent thing is by the form of contradiction to that.

original: ṣaṣṭhe tu pakṣe viruddhadharmayoga eva vastunyasadvyavahārahetutayā vyapadiśyate /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe tu pakṣe viruddha dharma yogaḥ eva vastuni asat vyavahāra hetutayā vyapadiśyate
translated: But in the sixth case, the mere possession of contradictory properties is indicated as the cause of the designation of non-existence to an existent thing.

original: ghaṭo hi ghaṭātmanā san paṭātmanā punarasanniti nirdiśyate /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ hi ghaṭa ātmanā san paṭa ātmanā punar asān iti nirdiśyate
translated: For a pot, being existent in its own nature, is said to be non-existent in the nature of a cloth.

analyzed: san eva sva deśa kālayoḥ sva virodhi deśa kālayoḥ asān iti
translated: It is existent in its own place and time, but non-existent in places and times that are contradictory to it.

analyzed: upalambha anukūla tvāt lāghavāt ca idam eva ādriyante vṛddhāḥ iti
translated: The elders prefer this very [definition] because it is favorable to perception and is concise.

analyzed: atra ayam vivekaḥ sattā tādātmya tad itara saṃbandha anyatara lakṣaṇā
translated: Here is the distinction: existence is characterized by either identity or the relation of that [i.e., identity] or other [i.e., inherence].

analyzed: ayam ghaṭaḥ sti iti atra ghaṭa tādātmya lakṣaṇā sattā pratīyate
translated: In the sentence This pot exists, existence characterized by identity with pot is understood.

analyzed: atrā idānīm ghaṭaḥ sti iti atra ca etad deśa kāla saṃyoga lakṣaṇā
translated: In the sentence It exists here now, [existence] characterized by the relation of conjunction with this place and time is understood.

original: tathā ayaṃ paṭo nāstītyatra paṭatādātmyābhāvalakṣaṇā paṭātmanāsattā pratīyate /
analyzed: tathā ayam paṭaḥ na asti iti atra paṭa tādātmya abhāva lakṣaṇā paṭa ātmanā asattā pratīyate
translated: Similarly, in the sentence This cloth does not exist, non-existence in the nature of cloth characterized by the absence of identity with cloth is understood.

original: tatra tadā ghaṭo nāstītyatra ca taddeśakālasaṃyogābhāvalakṣaṇāsattā pratīyate /
analyzed: tatra tadā ghaṭaḥ na asti iti atra ca tad deśa kāla saṃyoga abhāva lakṣaṇa asattā pratīyate
translated: There, in the statement the pot does not exist there, the non-existence characterized by the absence of connection with that place and time is understood.

analyzed: evam bhāva abhāva rūpayoḥ sat asat tvayoḥ deśa ādi bhedena upapattiḥ ghaṭa ādau iti ekaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: Thus, the existence and non-existence in the form of existence and non-existence are established by the difference of place etc. in the case of a pot etc. - this is one view.

analyzed: abhāvaḥ pi bhāva antara rūpaḥ evā iti pakṣāntaraṇ
translated: The other view is that non-existence is also of the form of another existence.

original: yathā ghaṭatvameva hi ayaṃ ghaṭo 'stītyatra pratītaṃ ghaṭasya sattvam /
analyzed: yathā ghaṭa tvam eva hi ayam ghaṭaḥ sti iti atra pratītam ghaṭasya sattvam
translated: For example, the existence of the pot is understood as the very potness in the statement this pot exists.

analyzed: tat eva ayam paṭaḥ na asti iti atra api pratīyate paṭāt bheda rūpam
translated: That very thing is understood as the absence of the cloth in the statement this is not a cloth, in the form of difference from the cloth.

original: evaṃ svadeśakālasaṃbandhalakṣaṇā sattaivānyadeśakālanāstitāpratītāvapi viṣayo bhavati deśāntarādisaṃbandhābhāvatveneti /
analyzed: evam sva deśa kāla saṃbandha lakṣaṇā sattā eva anya deśa kāla nāstitā pratītau api viṣayaḥ bhavati deśa antara ādi saṃbandha abhāva tvena iti
translated: Similarly, existence characterized by connection with one's own place and time becomes the object even in the understanding of non-existence in another place and time, by being the absence of connection with another place etc.

original: tathā ca dharmaviśeṣa eva bhāvānāmastināstipratītigocara iti siddham /
analyzed: tathā ca dharma viśeṣaḥ eva bhāvānām asti nāsti pratīti gocaraḥ iti siddham
translated: Thus, it is established that the existence and non-existence are the objects of the understanding of the particular properties of things.

original: idameva siddhāntināmapi saṃmatamiti // // // //🔽nanu deśādisambandhaḥ sata evopapadyate /
analyzed: idam eva siddhāntinām api saṃmatam iti  nanu deśa ādi sambandhaḥ sataḥ eva upapadyate
translated: This is accepted by the followers of the established doctrine also.🔽But the connection with place etc. is possible only for an existent thing.

analyzed: na deśa kāla sambandhāt asataḥ sattvam iṣyate  /
translated: The existence of a non-existent thing is not accepted on the ground of its connection with place and time.

original: sambadho dvyāśrayastasmātsataḥ sattvaṃ sadā bhavet /🔽asataḥ kārakaiḥ sattvaṃ janmanetyatidurghaṭam // //
analyzed: dvi āśrayaḥ tasmāt sataḥ sattvam sadā bhavet  asataḥ kārakaiḥ sattvam janmanā iti ati durghaṭam
translated: The relation is based on two things. Therefore, the existence of an existent would always be.🔽The existence of a non-existent by causes for the sake of production is extremely difficult to accomplish.

analyzed: ādi antavān sat kakṣyā antar niveśyate
translated: Therefore, the world with beginning and end is included within the category of existents.

original: uktaṃ ca ādāvante ca yannāsti nāsti madhye 'pi tattathā iti /
analyzed: uktam ca ādau ante ca yat na asti na asti madhye tat tathā iti
translated: And it is said: What does not exist in the beginning and end does not exist in the middle either.

analyzed: atas niścita sadbhāvaḥ sadā san abhyuyeyatām
translated: Therefore, let that which is ascertained to exist always be accepted as existent.

original: avirodhena sadasattvasamarthanasamahamānaḥ sattvaikāntyavādī kāpilo 'tra pratyavatiṣṭhate nanu deśādīti /
analyzed: avirodhena sat asat tva samarthana samahamānaḥ sattva aikāntya vādī kāpilaḥ tra pratyavatiṣṭhate nanu deśa ādi iti
translated: The follower of the Kapila school, who advocates the extreme of existence, who is capable of supporting the coherence of existence and non-existence without contradiction, replies here: But surely, space and so on...

analyzed: pūrvam asataḥ ghaṭa ādeḥ sva deśa kāla saṃbandhena sattā utpattyā durupapādā
translated: Previously, the production of the existence of a non-existent pot and so on through the relation of its own place and time was difficult to establish.

analyzed: saṃbandhasya saṃyogasya saṃbandhi dvaya janyasya asati saṃbandhini atarasmin api samutpatteḥ ayogāt
translated: Because the relation, which is conjunction, which is produced by the two relata, is not possible if either of the relata does not exist.

analyzed: tathā ca sva deśa kāla saṃbandhāt sattvam
translated: And thus, existence is due to the relation of its own place and time.

analyzed: sattve ca sva deśa kāla saṃbandhaḥ iti anyonya saṃśrayaḥ
translated: And if it exists, there is the relation of its own place and time. This is mutual dependence.

original: ataḥ sattvameva sadā mantavyaṃ bhāvānāmitisataḥ sattvaṃ sadā bhavedityantasyārthaḥ /
analyzed: atas sattvam eva sadā mantavyam bhāvānām iti sataḥ sattvam sadā bhavet iti antasya arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the latter part is that the existence of existent things should always be considered as real.

analyzed: nanu sadā sattve kāraka cakra vyāpāra ānarthakyam prasajyeta
translated: But if [existence] always exists, the activity of the group of causes would be purposeless.

analyzed: tat pūrvam asataḥ eva kāraka vyāpāreṇa utpattiḥ vācyā iti atra āha asataḥ iti
translated: To that [the author] says of the non-existent [in the verse].

original: asataḥ prayatnaśatenāpi niṣpattyā sattvaṃ durupapādaṃ sikatābhyastailasyeva /🔽kiñcāsata utpattau daṇḍacakrādito 'sattvāviśeṣādghaṭasyeva paṭasyāpyutpādaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: asataḥ prayatna śatena api niṣpattyā sattvam durupapādam sikatābhyaḥ tailasya iva  kiñca asataḥ utpattau daṇḍa cakra āditas sattva aviśeṣāt ghaṭasya iva paṭasya api utpāda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: The existence of the non-existent is difficult to establish even with a hundred efforts, like oil from sand.🔽Moreover, if the non-existent were to arise, like a cloth, a pot would also arise due to the non-difference of non-existence from a stick, wheel, etc.

analyzed: kenacid ed vyāpāreṇa śaśe śṛṅgasya kadācid udaya prasaṅgaḥ ca
translated: And due to some activity, the horn of a rabbit might sometimes arise.

analyzed: etat anusandhānena uktam iti
translated: With this in mind, it is said [in the verse].

analyzed: nanu upādāna viśeṣe kārya viśeṣa utpādana sāmarthya pratiniyamāt na atiprasaṅgaḥ iti ced mā evam
translated: If it is argued that there is no over-extension because there is a restriction of the ability to produce a particular effect in a particular material cause, that is not so.

analyzed: kārya garbha tvam antarā sāmarthya niyamasya api durnirūpa tvāt
translated: Because the restriction of ability is difficult to determine without the effect being contained [in the cause].

analyzed: tat sat eva kāryam kāraka vyāpāreṇa abhivyajyate iti eṣṭavyam iti āha ādi antavān iti
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the effect, which is real, is manifested by the activity of the causes. [The author] says having a beginning and an end [in the verse].

analyzed: āvirbhāva tirobhāva lakṣaṇau eva ca ādi antau utpāda vināśau iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And the beginning and end are characterized by appearance and disappearance, that is, origination and destruction.

analyzed: atra saṃvādaḥ ādau iti
translated: Here is the agreement: In the beginning, etc.

analyzed: atas iti  sattvena sadā san eva iti iṣyatām iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, etc.🔽It should be accepted that it is always existent, always pervaded by existence.

original: asataḥ sarvadāsattvaṃ janyayogāt khapuṣpavat /🔽asattve na viśeṣo 'sti prāgatyantāsatoriha // //
analyzed: asataḥ sarvadā asattvam janya yogāt khapuṣpa vat  asattve na viśeṣaḥ sti prāk atyanta asatoḥ iha
translated: Of the non-existent, there is always non-existence, because of the connection with the produced, like a sky-flower.🔽In non-existence, there is no distinction here between the absolutely non-existent and the previously non-existent.

analyzed: iti prapañcasya sattva pakṣa samarthanam asatā eti
translated: Thus, the defense of the position that the world exists. Of the non-existent, etc.

analyzed: janya yogāt utpatti ayogāt
translated: Because of the connection with the produced, because of the impossibility of origination.

analyzed: prāk ati anta asatoḥ pūrvam asatā utyanta asataḥ ca
translated: Of the absolutely non-existent and the previously non-existent.

analyzed: iti kāpila matam upapāditam
translated: Thus, the Sāṃkhya view has been explained.🔽Here, the part of the text is considered to be lost, which is devoted to the refutation of the Sāṃkhya view that has been explained,

original: atropapāditasya kāpilamatasya pratikṣepaparaḥ /🔽matāntaropapādanapratikṣepaparaśca granthabhāgo vilupta ityūhyate /
analyzed: atra upapāditasya kāpila matasya pratikṣepa paraḥ  mata antara upapādana pratikṣepa paraḥ ca grantha bhāgaḥ viluptaḥ iti ūhyate
translated: and which is also devoted to the refutation of the explanation of other views.

analyzed: buddhi saukaryāya sāṅkhya pakṣa pratikṣepa prakāraḥ diś mātram pradarśyate tra
translated: For the sake of ease of understanding, just a rough indication of the method of refuting the Sāṃkhya position is given here.

analyzed: dvavyam tāvat nityam eva
translated: Substance is indeed eternal.

analyzed: avasthā bhedāḥ tu ghaṭa tva kapāla tva ādayaḥ āgantukāḥ
translated: But the differences in states, such as being a pot and being a shard, are adventitious.

analyzed: avasthā viśeṣa sampatti arthaḥ eva ca kāraka vyāpāraḥ
translated: And the activity of the causal factors is only for the sake of attaining a particular state.

analyzed: dravyasya sattvāt eva kāraka vyāpāra gocara tvam avasthā antara bhāktvam ca ghaṭate
translated: The existence of the substance itself makes it possible for it to be the object of the activity of the causal factors and to attain another state.

original: anvayavyatirekābhyāṃ ca kārakacakrasya tasya tasya tatra tatra kārye sāmarthyaniyamaḥ sidhyatīti nātiprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: anvaya vyatirekābhyām ca kāraka cakrasya tasya tasya tatra tatra kārye sāmarthya niyamaḥ sidhyati iti na atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: And by positive and negative concomitance, the restriction of the efficacy of each causal factor in each effect is established, so there is no over-extension.

analyzed: tad tad avasthā viśiṣṭa veṣeṇa jāta tva naṣṭa tva ādi pratītiḥ ca upapadyate
translated: And the cognition of being produced, destroyed, etc. in the form distinguished by those states is also possible.

analyzed: kāraka cakrasya abhivyañjaka tvam iti pakṣe tu kāraka jñāpaka vibhāga ayogaḥ
translated: But if the view is that the causal factors are the manifestors, then it is not possible to distinguish between causal factors and indicators.

analyzed: abhivyakteḥ jñānāt bhede prakāra antareṇa utpattiḥ eva āpatitā
translated: If manifestation is different from cognition, then it would be produced in a different way.

analyzed: kiñca abhivyakteḥ nitya tve kāraka vyāpāra vaiyarthyam eva
translated: Moreover, if manifestation is eternal, then the activity of the causal factors would be pointless.

analyzed: tasyāḥ utpādya tve tu asatkārya vāda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If another manifestation of it is accepted, there would be an infinite regress.🔽If it is produced, then it would lead to the doctrine of non-existent effects.

analyzed: tad abhivyakteḥ utpatti upagamataḥ yathopalambham tasya utpattiḥ upagantum ucitā
translated: Therefore, it is proper to accept its production according to its apprehension, by accepting the production of that manifestation.

analyzed: sat eva dravyam avasthā antara bhāj satkāryam bhavati iti eva satkārya vādaḥ saṃrakṣaṇīyaḥ
translated: The doctrine of satkārya should be preserved as follows: the existent substance becomes the effect by undergoing a change of state.

analyzed: ayam eva ca trayī anta siddhaḥ pi iti
translated: And this is established in the end of the three Vedas.

analyzed: āvidyaḥ bheda prapañcaḥ mithyā
translated: The manifold world of difference is false, due to ignorance.

analyzed: advitīya śrutyā ca mithyātvam gamyate
translated: And falsity is understood from the statement of non-duality.

original: tacca pratītibādhābhyāṃ sadasadvilakṣaṇatvasiddheḥ supratiṣṭhitamiti hi māyāvādināṃ matam /
analyzed: tat ca pratīti bādhābhyām sat asat vilakṣaṇa tva siddheḥ su pratiṣṭhitam iti hi māyā vādinām matam
translated: And that is well-established, because it is established as being different from existence and non-existence by the contradiction of experience, this is the opinion of the Mādhyamikas.

analyzed: tat ca pūrva uttara praghaṭṭakaiḥ pratikṣipta prāyam eva iti bodhyam
translated: And that is almost refuted by the previous and subsequent sections. This should be understood.

analyzed: śvetaketum upādāya tattvam iti api yat śrutam
translated: Beginning with Śvetaketu, what is heard as that

analyzed: ṣaṣṭha prapāṭhake tasya kutas mukhya artha sambhavaḥ  /
translated: In the sixth chapter, how can there be a primary meaning for that?

analyzed: atha nirviśeṣa cit mātra brahma ātma aikya jñānam eva avidyā nivartakam
translated: Now, the knowledge of the identity of the self with Brahman, which is pure consciousness without distinctions, alone removes ignorance.

original: nirviśeṣacinmātrabrahmātmaikyaṃ catattvamasivākyapratipannamiti vādamadvaitināṃ pratikṣeptuṃ tattvamasivākyārthavicāramupakramate śvetaketumiti
analyzed: nirviśeṣa cit mātra brahma ātma aikyam ca tattvamasi vākya pratipannam iti vādam advaitinām pratikṣeptum tattvamasi vākya artha vicāram upakramate śvetaketum iti
translated: And the identity of the self with Brahman, which is pure consciousness without distinctions, is understood from the sentence That thou art. To refute the doctrine of the Advaitins, he begins the examination of the meaning of the sentence That thou art with the words Śvetaketu.

analyzed: upādāya sambodhya
translated: Beginning with means having instructed.

analyzed: chāndogyaḥ ityādiḥ
translated: The word Chāndogya etc.

analyzed: jīva brahma aikye tattvamasi vākyam eva mukhyam pramāṇam abhimanyate taiḥ
translated: In the identity of the individual soul and Brahman, they consider the sentence That thou art to be the principal proof.

original: asyāpi samānādhikaraṇavākyasya mukhyārthatvaṃ tanmate na saṃbhavatītyahatasyetyādinā // //
analyzed: asya api samāna adhikaraṇa vākyasya mukhya artha tvam tad mate na saṃbhavati iti ahatasya ityādinā
translated: Even this sentence of the same case cannot have the primary meaning in their opinion. Therefore, it is said beginning with of that which is unborn.

analyzed: kārpaṇya śoka duḥkha ārtaḥ cetanaḥ tvaṃpadā uditaḥ
translated: The one denoted by the word thou is afflicted with meanness, sorrow and pain, is conscious,
omniscient, of true resolve, an ocean of unlimited bliss,

analyzed: tad padārthaḥ tayoḥ aikyam tejaḥ timira vat katham  kārpaṇyā iti
translated: how can the identity of those two be like light and darkness?🔽Meanness etc.

analyzed: kārpaṇyam dainyam
translated: Meanness is wretchedness.

analyzed: gati śūnyatā
translated: Lack of progress.

analyzed: śokaḥ gata duḥkha anusandhāna jā citta vaiyākulī
translated: Sorrow is mental distress born from not recollecting past sufferings.

analyzed: duḥkham vartamāna aniṣṭa anubhava lakṣaṇam
translated: Pain is the characteristic of experiencing present unpleasant things.

original: samānavibhaktyā pratipannamaikyaṃ jīveśvarayorviruddhasvabhāvayorna ghaṭata iti mukhyārthāsaṃbhava evetyāśayaḥ // //
analyzed: samāna vibhaktyā pratipannam aikyam jīva īśvarayoḥ viruddha svabhāvayoḥ na ghaṭate iti mukhya artha asaṃbhavaḥ eva iti āśayaḥ
translated: The intended meaning is that the identity of the individual soul and the Lord, which is understood by the common case ending, is not possible because of their contradictory natures, so there is simply the impossibility of the primary meaning.

analyzed: tvam artha sthe taṭa sthe vā    vibhedake
translated: Whether the meaning of thou is in the neutral state or in the state of identity,

analyzed: guṇe tattvam pada śrutyoḥ aikārthyam dūra vāritam
translated: in the attribute that distinguishes, the oneness of the words tat and tvam is far removed.

analyzed: tvam artha sthā iti
translated: In the meaning of 'thou' etc.

analyzed: tvam artha niṣṭhaḥ guṇaḥ jña tva duḥkhi tva ādiḥ
translated: You are the attribute of the object, such as ignorance, suffering, etc.

analyzed: tad artha niṣṭhaḥ ca sarvajña tva jagat kāraṇa tva ādiḥ
translated: And the object of that is omniscience, being the cause of the world, etc.

analyzed: sa ca brahmaṇaḥ taṭastha lakṣaṇa tvena para abhimataḥ
translated: And that is accepted by the opponent as the secondary characteristic of Brahman.

analyzed: anayoḥ dharmayoḥ āśraya bhedaka tvāt tattvam arthayoḥ aikyam su dūra nirastam aśva gardabhayoḥ iva iti arthaḥ
translated: The purpose of this is that the identity of the two, object and meaning, is far removed, like that of a horse and a donkey, because these two attributes are different bases.

analyzed: ajña tva sarva vedi tva duḥkhi tva sukhi tā ādike
translated: Ignorance, omniscience, suffering, happiness, etc.,

analyzed: viśeṣaṇe vā cit dhātoḥ athavā api upalakṣaṇe
translated: are either the characteristics of the essence of consciousness, or the distinguishing marks.

analyzed: viruddha guṇa saṅkānteḥ bhedaḥ syāt tu an tad arthayoḥ
translated: Due to the contradiction of the collection of opposite qualities, there would be difference between you and that object.

analyzed: nanu ajña tva ādi sarvajña tva ādi ca upalakṣaṇatayā eva ucyate
translated: But ignorance, etc. and omniscience, etc. are stated only as distinguishing marks,

analyzed: na tu viśeṣaṇa tayā
translated: not as characteristics.

analyzed: ubhaya upalakṣitam vastu ekam eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the single entity characterized by both is one only.

analyzed: atas na virodhaḥ iti atra āha ajña tva iti
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction. In this regard, it is said: ignorance, etc.

analyzed: cit dhātoḥ
translated: of the essence of consciousness, of the nature of consciousness.

original: upalakṣaṇatve 'pi ajñatvādinopalakṣyasya jīvabhāvasya sarvajñatvādinopalakṣyasyeśvarabhāvasya ca vaiyadhikaraṇyādeva tvantadarthayoraikyaṃ
analyzed: upalakṣaṇa tve pi ajña tva ādinā upalakṣyasya jīva bhāvasya sarvajña tva ādinā upalakṣyasya īśvara bhāvasya ca vaiyadhikaraṇyāt eva tu an tad arthayoḥ aikyam
translated: Even if it is a distinguishing mark, due to the difference of the substratum of what is distinguished by ignorance, etc., the state of the individual soul, and of what is distinguished by omniscience, etc., the state of the Lord, there is difference between you and that object.

analyzed: na sidhyati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not established.🔽The restriction to a single manifestation of consciousness due to the destruction of a part of the denoted object,

analyzed: saḥ yam gauḥ ivat tattvam padayoḥ iti apeśalam
translated: This is not appropriate, like in the case of this is a cow, in the case of the words tat tvam.

analyzed: nanu virodhāt mukhya arthaḥ tyajyate
translated: But due to contradiction, the primary meaning is abandoned.

analyzed: cit mātre tu pada dvaya lakṣaṇā upeyate
translated: But in mere consciousness, the characteristic of the two words is obtained.

original: yathā so 'yaṃ raurityatra tattedantopalakṣite vastumātre lakṣaṇā padadvayasya tatheti śaṅkate vācyeti /
analyzed: yathā saḥ yam rauḥ iti atra tad ted anta upalakṣite vastu mātre lakṣaṇā pada dvayasya tathā iti śaṅkate vācyā iti
translated: Just as in this is a cow, the characteristic of the two words is in the mere object indicated by the demonstrative pronoun tat and idam, similarly, he doubts with vācya etc.

original: vācyaikadeśasya pravṛttinimittabhedasya tyāgena viśeṣyamātre cinmātre padadvayasya vṛttiḥ jahadajahallakṣaṇayeti /🔽etatpratikṣipatiityapyapeśalamiti /
analyzed: vācya eka deśasya pravṛtti nimitta bhedasya tyāgena viśeṣya mātre cit mātre pada dvayasya vṛttiḥ jahat ajahat lakṣaṇayā iti  etat pratikṣipati iti api apeśalam iti
translated: By abandoning the denoted object, which is the cause of usage, the application of the two words is only in mere consciousness, which is the qualifier, by the method of abandoning and not abandoning.🔽He rejects this with ityapyeṣalam.

analyzed: apeśalam asundaram
translated: Ityapyeṣalam means this is also inappropriate.

analyzed: eka pada lakṣaṇayā eva virodha parihāre pada dvaya lakṣaṇā kalpanā na manoramā iti arthaḥ
translated: By the mere characteristic of one word, the contradiction is avoided. The assumption of the characteristic of the two words is not pleasing, is the meaning.

analyzed: deśa kāla daśā bhedāt ekasmin api dharmiṇi
translated: Due to the difference of place, time, and condition, even in a single characterized object,

analyzed: viruddha dvandva saṅkānteḥ saḥ yam gauḥ iti yujyate
translated: the contradiction of the two opposing pairs is entered, therefore this is a cow is appropriate.

analyzed: dṛṣṭānte pada dvayasya api na lakṣaṇā iti āha deśa kāla iti
translated: In the example, he says that there is no characteristic of even the two words with deśakāla.

analyzed: tad tā nāma tad deśa kāla yogi tā
translated: That is the connection with the place and time of that.

analyzed: idantā etad deśa kāla yogi tā
translated: This is the connection with the place and time of this.

original: tattāviśiṣṭe idantānvayasya bādhe 'pi ekasmin dharmiṇyubhayānvaye na virodhaḥ /
analyzed: tad tā viśiṣṭe id anta anvayasya bādhe pi ekasmin dharmiṇi ubhaya anvaye na virodhaḥ
translated: Even when the relation of this to that qualified by that is contradicted, there is no contradiction in the relation of both to the same substratum.

analyzed: deśa dvaya saṃbandhaḥ paricchinnasya vastunaḥ kāla bhedāt parihriyate
translated: The connection with two places of a limited entity is excluded due to the difference in time.

analyzed: kāla dvaya sambandhaḥ tu sthira tvāt eva nirūhyate
translated: But the connection with two times is ascertained itself due to permanence.

original: prātipadikābhyāṃ deśadvayakāladvayasaṃbandhasya samānavibhaktyā tadāśrayadravyaikyasya ca pratipādane na virodhaleśo 'pi /
analyzed: prātipadikābhyām deśa dvaya kāla dvaya saṃbandhasya samāna vibhaktyā tad āśraya dravya aikyasya ca pratipādane na
translated: When the connection with two places and two times is conveyed by the two verbal roots, and the identity of the substance based on that is conveyed by the same case ending, there is not even a trace of contradiction.

analyzed: asmin eva arthe sā uyam iti vākyasya tātparyam
translated: The purport of the sentence this is that is precisely this meaning.

analyzed: tat na pada dvaya lakṣaṇā dṛṣṭānte iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in the example, there is no secondary meaning of the two words.

analyzed: sva prakāśasya cit dhātoḥ viruddha dvandva saṅgatau
translated: In the case of the self-luminous essence of consciousness, which is associated with mutually contradictory pairs,

analyzed: na vyavasthāpakam kiñcid deśa kāla daśā ādike  /
translated: there is no determiner at all in terms of place, time, situation, etc.

original: na tvevaṃ bhavatā vaktuṃ śakyata ityāhasvaprakāśasyeti /
analyzed: na tu evam bhavatā vaktum śakyate iti āha sva prakāśasya iti
translated: But this cannot be said in the same way, so it is said of the self-luminous one.

original: nirviśeṣe cinmātre viruddhadharmadvayasambandhasyāvirodhopapādakaṃ deśakālāvasthābhedādau kiñcidapi na ghaṭate /
analyzed: nirviśeṣe cit mātre viruddha dharma dvaya sambandhasya avirodha upapādakam deśa kāla avasthā bheda ādau kiñcid api na ghaṭate
translated: In the non-dual consciousness alone, the connection of two contradictory attributes is not possible to be reconciled by any difference in place, time, or state.

analyzed: svayam prakāśa svarūpa tvāt ajñānam api avirodha upapādakam na śakya śaṅka tasmin iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that because it is self-luminous by nature, ignorance also cannot be suspected to be the reconciler of non-contradiction in it.

analyzed: nirdhūta nikhila dvandva sva prakāśe cit ātmani
translated: In the self-luminous consciousness, which is free from all pairs of opposites,

analyzed: dvaita anartha bhrama abhāvāt śāstram nirviṣayam bhavet
translated: the scriptures would be objectless, due to the absence of the delusion of the harm of duality.

original: brahmaṇyavidyānvayāyogādevāvidyākṛtabhedadarśananirasanārthatvaṃ śāstrasya nirviśeṣacinmātra brahmātmaikyaviṣayatvaṃ ca parābhimataṃ na saṃbhavītyāhanirdhūteti
analyzed: brahmaṇi avidyā anvaya ayogāt eva avidyā kṛta bheda darśana nirasana artha tvam śāstrasya nirviśeṣa cit mātra brahma ātma aikya viṣayatvam ca para abhimatam na saṃbhavi iti āha nirdhūta iti
translated: Because Brahman cannot be connected with ignorance, the intended purpose of the scriptures to refute the view of difference created by ignorance, and the oneness of Brahman with non-distinct consciousness alone as the self, which is accepted by the opponent, is not possible. He says free from etc.

analyzed: dvandva śabdaḥ bheda vācī atra
translated: The word pair means difference here.

analyzed: ajñānena eva bheda bhramaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: The delusion of difference should be said to be due to ignorance itself.

original: na ca nirviśeṣe svaprakāśe ca tatprasaktiḥ /
analyzed: na ca nirviśeṣe sva prakāśe ca tad prasaktiḥ
translated: And that is not possible in the non-distinct and self-luminous.

analyzed: tad nirasanīyasya asiddheḥ tad nirāsaka tva abhimata aikya jñāne śāstra tātparyam na kalpayitum śakyam
translated: Because what is to be refuted by that is not established, the intended purpose of the scriptures in the knowledge of oneness, which is accepted to be the refuter of that, cannot be imagined.

analyzed: tat nirarthakam āpadyeta adhyātma śāstram tattvam asi mahāvākyam vā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the science of the self and the great statement That art thou would become meaningless.

analyzed: etena avidyā kṛta antaḥkaraṇa bhedaḥ eva jīva īśvara bhāva kalpaka upādhiḥ cit mātre iti api parastam
translated: By this, it should be understood that the difference in the internal organ created by ignorance itself is the limiting adjunct in pure consciousness that gives rise to the relation between the individual soul and God.

analyzed: avidyāyāḥ eva asambhavāt tatra iti bodhyam
translated: It should be understood that this is because ignorance itself is impossible there.

analyzed: etena satya kāma tva jagat kāraṇatā ādayaḥ
translated: By this, the true desires, being the cause of the world, and so on,

analyzed: pare
translated: are superimposed on the supreme, which is limited by Maya, by others.

analyzed: dhyastāḥ śoka moha dayaḥ punar
translated: Grief, delusion, and so on are superimposed again.

analyzed: avidyā upādhike jīve vināśe nā iti yat matam
translated: The view that destruction does not exist in the individual soul limited by ignorance,

analyzed: kṣudra brahma vidām etat matam prāk eva dūṣitam
translated: is the view of the knowers of the lesser Brahman, which has already been refuted earlier.

original: cinmātre brahmaṇyavidyānvayānupapattiparyālocanayā kaiścidadvaitibhiḥ kalpitaṃ māyāvidyopādhibhedaṃ tata eveśeśitavyabhedaṃ cāparamārthamupapādyamānaṃ
analyzed: cit mātre brahmaṇi avidyā anvaya anupapatti paryālocanayā kaiścid advaitibhiḥ kalpitam māyā vidyā upādhi bhedam tatas evā īśa īśitavya bhedam ca a paramārtham upapādyamānam
translated: By some non-dualists, the difference of limiting adjuncts of Maya and ignorance, which is imagined in Brahman, pure consciousness, by the consideration that ignorance is not possible in it, and the difference of the object of knowledge and the knower, which is only in that, are established as unreal.🔽This is refuted by

analyzed: nirasyati etena iti
translated: by this.
By this, in pure consciousness, where the three kinds of difference are removed, the difference of the limiting adjuncts of Maya and ignorance is not established.

analyzed: māyā upādhau māyā upahita cit mātre pare īśvare
translated: In the supreme God, who is limited by Maya, by the consciousness limited by Maya,

analyzed: vināśena iti
translated: by destruction.

original: tattvamasivākyajanyaikyasākṣātkāreṇa māyāvidyopādhināśe tatkalpita īśajīvabhāvo 'pi nivṛtto nāvatiṣṭhata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: tattvamasi vākya janya aikya sākṣātkāreṇa māyā vidyā upādhi nāśe tad kalpitaḥ īśa jīva bhāvaḥ nivṛttaḥ na avatiṣṭhate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when the non-dual direct realization produced by the sentence That thou art destroys the limiting adjuncts of māyā and ignorance, the imagined state of the Lord and the individual soul also ceases and does not continue.

analyzed: prāk eva dūṣitam iti
translated: This has been refuted earlier.

analyzed: etad dūṣaṇa bhāgaḥ viluptaḥ
translated: The part of the refutation of this has been lost.

analyzed: aparama artha tvena abhimatayoḥ tayoḥ kalpaka abhāvāt asiddhiḥ eva
translated: If they are considered to be unreal, there is non-establishment due to the absence of a conceiver.

analyzed: svatas kalpanāyām ātmā āśrayaḥ
translated: If they are self-conceived, there is the fallacy of circular reasoning.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ eva tad kalpaka tve brahma svarūpasya nitya tvāt tayoḥ nitya tva prasaktiḥ
translated: If Brahman itself is the conceiver of them, then they would be eternal because the nature of Brahman is eternal.

original: aikyajñānena nivṛttyupagame 'pi tasya kṣaṇikatvādeva punarapi brahmasvarūpabalāttayoḥ kalpanāprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: aikya jñānena nivṛtti upagame tasya kṣaṇika tvāt eva punar api brahma svarūpa balāt tayoḥ kalpanā prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Even if it is accepted that they cease by the knowledge of non-duality, due to the momentariness of that knowledge itself, there would be the possibility of conceiving them again by the power of the nature of Brahman.

original: kiñca māyāyā bhrāntijanakatve duḥkhādijanakatve cāvidyāto vibhāgāsiddhiḥ /
analyzed: kiñca māyāyāḥ bhrānti janaka tve duḥkha ādi janaka tve ca avidyātaḥ vibhāga asiddhiḥ
translated: Moreover, if māyā is the producer of error and the producer of suffering etc., the distinction from ignorance is not established.

analyzed: tasyāḥ yathārtha buddhi janaka tve krīḍā rasa mātra parikara tve ca apuruṣa artha tva ayogāt tad nirasana anupapattiḥ
translated: If it is the producer of true knowledge and is merely an accessory for the rasa of play, then it is not proper for it to be not a human goal, and its cessation is not possible.

analyzed: anādi bhāva rūpāyāḥ tasyāḥ jñāna mātrataḥ nirasana ayogaḥ ca ityādi dūṣaṇam anusandheyam
translated: And it is not proper for it to be ceased merely by knowledge, as it has existed from beginningless time. Such refutations should be understood.

original: avidyāyā eva bahusaṃmatatvānmāyāvidyopādhibhedavādino 'mī kṣudrā brahmavido 'dvaitiṣviti ca bodhyam // // //
analyzed: avidyāyāḥ eva bahu saṃmata tvāt māyā avidyā upādhi bheda vādinaḥ kṣudrāḥ brahma vidaḥ dvaitiṣu iti ca bodhyam  /
translated: It should be understood that these small knowers of Brahman, who speak of the distinctions of Maya, ignorance, and limiting adjuncts, are indeed among the non-dualists.

analyzed: cit svarūpe viśiṣṭe vā māyā avidyā ādi upādhayaḥ
translated: Whether the nature of consciousness is distinguished or not, it is limited by Maya, ignorance, and other adjuncts.
In the former case, there is a mixture of everything due to the non-distinction of the individual souls and the supreme Self.

analyzed: uttarasmin api tathā viśiṣṭam api cit yadi
translated: In the latter case also, if consciousness is distinguished even though it is distinguished,

analyzed: cit svarūpam hi nirbhedam māyā avidyā ādi upādhibhiḥ
translated: The nature of consciousness is indeed undifferentiated by the adjuncts of Maya, ignorance, and others.

original: vibhinnamiva vibhrāntaṃ viśiṣṭaṃ ca / / / mataṃ tava // //
analyzed: vibhinnam iva vibhrāntam viśiṣṭam ca matam tava
translated: It is considered by you to be as if differentiated and deluded, and distinguished.

analyzed: upādhi bheda upagama asambhavaḥ iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the acceptance of the difference of adjuncts is not possible.

analyzed: tad upagamena dūṣaṇa antaram ca ucyate cit svarūpe iti
translated: Another fault due to that acceptance is stated in the verse whether the nature of consciousness is...

analyzed: kim cit mātre māyā avidyā ādi upādhayaḥ saṃbandhante
translated: Do the adjuncts of Maya, ignorance, and others relate to mere consciousness?

analyzed: uta viśiṣṭe
translated: Or to the distinguished one?

original: niraṃśe cinmātre māyāvidyāsambandhe tatprayuktasvabhāvabhedā ekasminneva prasajyante iti jīveśvarasvabhāvasāṅkaryaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: niraṃśe cit mātre māyā avidyā sambandhe tad prayukta svabhāva bhedāḥ ekasmin eva prasajyante iti jīva īśvara svabhāva sāṅkarya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If there is a connection of Maya and ignorance with mere consciousness, which is partless, then the differences in nature caused by that are entailed even in the single [consciousness], leading to the undesirable consequence of a mixture of the natures of individual souls and the supreme Self.

analyzed: viśiṣṭe ced kim tat viśeṣaṇam
translated: If it is said that it is distinguished, what is that distinguishing feature?

analyzed: māyā avidyā ca iti ced ātma āśrayaḥ
translated: If it is said to be Maya and ignorance, there is a logical fallacy.

analyzed: jīva tva īśvara tve iti ced anyonya āśrayaḥ
translated: If it be said that (the difference is due to) the state of being a living being and the state of being God, (we reply that) this is a case of mutual dependence.

analyzed: anyat tu viśeṣaṇam durvacam eva
translated: Any other distinction is indeed hard to state.

original: kiñca māyayāvidyayā vā saṃvitsvarūpasya cchedāsambhavādekameva tattadupahitaṃ bhavedgaganamiva maṭhāntavartighaṭena maṭhena copahitam /
analyzed: kiñca māyayā avidyayā vā saṃvid svarūpasya cheda asambhavāt ekam eva tat tat upahitam bhavet gaganam iva maṭha anta varti ghaṭena maṭhena ca upahitam
translated: Moreover, since the form of consciousness cannot be divided by illusion or Nescience, it would be one only, limited by those (bodies), like the sky (which is one only, limited by) a temple or a jar situated in the temple.

original: tathā ca hastapādādyavacchinnasukhaduḥkhabhoga ekasyaiva yathā jīvasya /
analyzed: tathā ca hasta pāda ādi avacchinna sukha duḥkha bhogaḥ ekasya eva yathā jīvasya
translated: And thus, just as the experience of pleasure and pain limited by the hands, feet, etc. belongs to one living being only,

original: tathā tattadupādhiprayuktaiśvaryaduḥkhādibhoga ekasyaiva brahmaṇaḥ prasajyata iti jīvaparasvabhāvāvyavasthitirevetyarthaḥ // // //
analyzed: tathā tad tad upādhi prayukta aiśvarya duḥkha ādi bhogaḥ ekasya eva brahmaṇaḥ prasajyate iti jīva para svabhāva avyavasthitiḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: so also the experience of power, pain, etc. due to those limiting adjuncts would belong to Brahman only. Thus there is no establishment of the nature of the individual soul and the Supreme Self. This is the meaning.

original: taṭasthāvasthitā dharmāḥ svarūpaṃ na spṛśanti kim /
analyzed: taṭa stha avasthitāḥ dharmāḥ sva rūpam na spṛśanti kim
translated: Do the limiting adjuncts, remaining apart, not touch the nature (of Brahman)?

analyzed: na hi daṇḍi śiraḥ chedāt devadattaḥ na hiṃsitaḥ  /
translated: For Devadatta is not killed by the cutting off of the head of a man with a stick.

analyzed: nanu aupādhika pradeśa bheda upagamāt brahmaṇi na jīva īśa svabhāva sāṅkaryam iti ced tatra āha taṭastha iti
translated: If it be said that there is no confusion of the nature of the individual soul and the Supreme Self in Brahman due to the acceptance of the difference of Brahman's regions due to limiting adjuncts, (we reply that) in that case (he says) 'the limiting adjuncts, remaining apart,' etc.

analyzed: māyayā avidyayā vā upahitam taṭastham iti ucyate brahma
translated: Brahman is said to be 'apart' when limited by illusion or Nescience.

original: tanniṣṭhasya sārvajñyāderajñatvādeśca daṇḍena kuṇḍalena vopahite kādācitkadaṇḍādiviśeṣaṇavattayā
analyzed: tad niṣṭhasya sārvajñya ādeḥ ajña tva ādeḥ ca daṇḍena kuṇḍalena vā upahite kādācitka daṇḍa ādi viśeṣaṇavat tayā
translated: For one who is devoted to that, omniscience etc. and non-omniscience etc. are superimposed by the ear-ring or the stick, as having the occasional attribute of the stick etc.

original: taṭasthaśabdite devadatte vartamānasya sukhasya duḥkhasya ca devadattātmanīva brahmaṇi
analyzed: taṭastha śabdite devadatte vartamānasya sukhasya duḥkhasya ca devadatta ātmani iva brahmaṇi
translated: Of that Brahman, which is qualified by the adventitious attributes of pleasure and pain, which are present in Devadatta, who is spoken of as standing apart, just as in the case of the soul of Devadatta,

analyzed: sambandhaḥ durvāraḥ evā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: the relation is irresistible.

original: tatrānanditvaprasaṅgasya sahyatvātkathañcihuḥkhitvasyāsahyasya prasaṅge nidarśanamāhanahīti /🔽upādhibhede 'pi viruddhasamāveśaprasaṅgo durvāraḥ /
analyzed: tatra ānandi tva prasaṅgasya sahya tvāt kathañcid huḥkhi tvasya asahyasya prasaṅge nidarśanam āha nahi iti  upādhi bhede pi viruddha samāveśa prasaṅgaḥ durvāraḥ
translated: Since the contingency of being the experiencer of bliss is tolerable, but the contingency of being the experiencer of pain is intolerable, he gives an example in the passage beginning with na hi.🔽Even in the case of difference of limiting adjuncts, the contingency of the inclusion of mutually contradictory attributes is irresistible.

analyzed: vastu bhedam antarā kalpita pradeśa bheda mātreṇa vyavasthā durghaṭā
translated: Without difference of reality, the establishment by mere difference of imagined regions is difficult.

analyzed: tathā ca māyā vidyā upādhi bhe da kalpanā apārthā iti sthitam
translated: And thus it is established that the assumption of difference of limiting adjuncts like māyā and avidyā is purposeless.🔽The meaning of the statement That thou art is not good,

analyzed: atas tat tvam asi ityādeḥ arthaḥ iti api asundaram
translated: because it is the mere remainder of consciousness after the exclusion of the non-intelligent part.

analyzed: iti tattvamasi vākyasya para abhimata brahma ātma aikya para tve
translated: Thus, the establishment of the identity of Brahman and the self as accepted by the opponent in the statement That thou art is shown to be untenable.

analyzed: etena māyā avidyā upādhi rūpa viśeṣaṇa bheda parityāgena viśeṣyībhūta cit mātra aikyam tattvamasi vākya arthaḥ iti api nirastam iti āha acit aṃśa iti
translated: By this, it is also refuted that the meaning of the sentence That thou art is the oneness of pure consciousness alone, which is the substratum, by abandoning the differences of qualifications in the form of the limiting adjuncts of illusion and ignorance. He says: In the non-intelligent part...

analyzed: brahmaṇi eva doṣa āpattiḥ ca iti uktam etāvatā
translated: The characteristic of the two words.🔽And it is said that the faults would apply to Brahman alone by this much.

analyzed: a brahma anātma tā bhāve pratyak cit pariśiṣyate  tattvam pada dvayam jīva para tādātmya gocaram
translated: When there is no existence of non-Brahman and non-self, the inward-turned consciousness remains.🔽The two words tat and tvam refer to the identity of the individual soul and the supreme self.

analyzed: tad mukhya vṛtti tādātmyam api vastu dvaya āśrayam
translated: That primary usage of identity also has as its basis two entities.

analyzed: atha para mate sāmānādhikaraṇya arthasya tādātmyasya api anupapattim upapādayati a brahma iti
translated: Now, in the supreme view, he explains the non-applicability of identity, which is the meaning of co-reference, by saying abrahma... etc.

original: brahmabhinnasyānātmatve tattvaṃpadadvayalakṣyārtha eka pratyaktatvaṃ cinmātramava śiṣyate /
analyzed: brahma bhinnasya anātma tve tattvaṃpada dvaya lakṣya arthaḥ śiṣyate
translated: If what is different from Brahman is not the self, then the inward-turned consciousness, which is the meaning denoted by the two words tat and tvam, remains as pure consciousness alone.

analyzed: tatra ca samāna adhikaraṇa vākya arthasya tādātmya asi anupapattiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: And in that case, the identity, which is the meaning of the co-referential sentence, is not applicable. This is the meaning.

analyzed: atra uttara ardham viluptam iti ūhyate
translated: Here, the latter half is said to be lost.

original: taccaekaśeṣe tu tādātmyaṃ cinmātre naiva sambhavet iti syāt /
analyzed: tat ca eka śeṣe tu tādātmyam cit mātre nā eva sambhavet iti syāt
translated: And that would be But in the collective remainder, identity is not possible in pure consciousness alone.

analyzed: ekaśeṣe tādātmya anupapattim eva vivṛṇoti tattvam iti
translated: In the case of the one-remaining, he explains the impossibility of identity itself thus: That is...

analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is having the same substratum.

analyzed: tasya mukhya vṛttiḥ yatra tat tat mukhya vṛtti
translated: That is the primary usage where it occurs.

analyzed: vastu dvaya āśrayam iti
translated: Having two things as its substratum.

analyzed: bheda samāna adhikaraṇa abhedasya tādātmyasya atyantāya abhede sambhavaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the non-difference of difference, which has the same substratum as non-difference, is not possible in absolute non-difference.

original: atra yādavaprakāśaprakriyayā bhāṭṭaprakriyayā vā nirūpyate tādātmyamiti bodhyam /
analyzed: atra yādavaprakāśa prakriyayā bhāṭṭa prakriyayā vā nirūpyate tādātmyam iti bodhyam
translated: Here, it should be understood that identity is determined either by the method of Yādava Prakāśa or by the method of Bhāṭṭa.

original: siddhānte tuvastudvayāśrayamityasya pravṛttinimittadharmabhedavadekavastvāśritamityarthaḥ /🔽dharmadvārakabhedaviśiṣṭasvarūpābheda eva ca tādātmyaṃ matamiti vivekaḥ // //
analyzed: siddhānte tu vastu dvaya āśrayam iti asya pravṛtti nimitta dharma bheda vat eka vastu āśritam iti arthaḥ  dharma dvāraka bheda viśiṣṭa svarūpa abhedaḥ eva ca tādātmyam matam iti vivekaḥ
translated: But in the established conclusion, the meaning of having two things as its substratum is having one thing as its substratum, which has the difference of the property that is the cause of activity.🔽And the distinction is that identity is considered to be the non-difference of the nature qualified by the difference that is mediated by the property.

analyzed: bheda abheda vikalpaḥ tu yaḥ tvayā paricoditaḥ
translated: The option regarding difference and non-difference that you have raised,

original: abhedābhedino 'satye bandhe sati nirarthakaḥ // //🔽nanu bhedābhedastādātmyamiti na saṃbhavati /
analyzed: satye bandhe sati nirarthakaḥ  nanu bheda abhedaḥ tādātmyam iti na saṃbhavati
translated: is pointless when the bond of non-difference and difference is not real.🔽Now, difference and non-difference cannot be identity.

analyzed: bheda abhedayoḥ abhede tyanta bhede pi bheda abhedasya asiddheḥ
translated: Because difference and non-difference are not established even in absolute difference when there is non-difference of difference and non-difference.

analyzed: bheda abhede vā tatra api tathā iti anavasthā iti ced tatra āha bheda abheda iti
translated: If it is argued that even there, there is an infinite regress because of the distinction and non-distinction, then he says because of the distinction and non-distinction, etc.

analyzed: ayam vikalpana prakāraḥ na upalabhyamāna grantha bhāge sti
translated: This method of option is not found in the part of the text that is available.

analyzed: tad bhāgaḥ viluptaḥ syāt vā
translated: That part may be lost, or

analyzed: bhinnayoḥ tādātmyam uta abhinnayoḥ
translated: whether the two are identical or different.

analyzed: ādye ghaṭaḥ paṭaḥ iti prasajyate
translated: If the first, it follows that the pot is the cloth.

original: antye ghaṭo ghaṭa itīti vā bhedābhedavikalpo bodhyaḥ /🔽abhedābhedinaḥbhedābhedibhinnasya /
analyzed: antye ghaṭaḥ ghaṭaḥ iti iti vā bheda abheda vikalpaḥ bodhyaḥ  abheda abhedinaḥ bheda abhedi bhinnasya
translated: If the latter, then either the pot is the pot, or the option of distinction and non-distinction should be understood.🔽Of that which is distinguished and non-distinguished, which is different from that which is distinguished and non-distinguished,

original: atyantabhinnasyātyantābhinnasya vā bandhe tādātmyasambandhe asatiaprāmāṇike sati bhavatkṛto 'yaṃ vikalpo 'pārtha ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: atyanta bhinnasya atyanta abhinnasya vā bandhe tādātmya sambandhe asati aprāmāṇike sati bhavat kṛtaḥ yam pārthaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: if there is no connection of identity, i.e., if it is not authoritative, then this option made by you is meaningless. This is the meaning.

original: na hi ghaṭo ghaṭa iti vā ghaṭaḥ paṭa iti vā sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ dṛṣṭam /
analyzed: na hi ghaṭaḥ ghaṭaḥ iti vā ghaṭaḥ paṭaḥ iti vā sāmānādhikaraṇyam dṛṣṭam
translated: For the co-reference of the pot is the pot or the pot is the cloth is not seen.

analyzed: kintu nīlaḥ ghaṭaḥ iti eva
translated: But only the pot is blue.

analyzed: tad bheda abhedaḥ eva tādātmyam
translated: That distinction and non-distinction itself must be accepted as identity.

analyzed: bheda abhedayoḥ bhedaḥ eva
translated: The distinction of distinction and non-distinction is itself.

original: na ca bhede tayorvirodhādekatra samāveśo na ghaṭata iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca bhede tayoḥ virodhāt ekatra samāveśaḥ na ghaṭate iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that because of the contradiction of those two in distinction, their inclusion in one thing is not possible.

analyzed: nīla ghaṭayoḥ pratīta tvāt eva tayoḥ virodha abhāvāt
translated: Because of the very cognition of the blue and the pot, there is no contradiction between them.

original: dharmato bhedaḥ svarūpato 'bheda iti vāvirodha iti bhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: dharmataḥ bhedaḥ svarūpataḥ bhedaḥ iti vā avirodhaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that there is no contradiction in saying that there is difference according to the nature of the thing, and non-difference according to the nature of the thing itself.

analyzed: abhedaḥ bheda mardī tu sva āśrayībhūta vastunoḥ
translated: Non-difference is the destroyer of difference between two things that are the substrata.

analyzed: bhedaḥ paraspara anātmyam bhāvānām evam etayoḥ
translated: Difference is the mutual non-self-nature of things. This is the case with these two.

analyzed: svarūpam abhyupetya eva bheda abheda vikalpayoḥ
translated: Having accepted the nature of the thing itself, the option of difference and non-difference is made.

analyzed: bheda abhedam vikalpayataḥ sva vyāghātaḥ pi iti āha abhedaḥ iti śloka dvayena
translated: For one who makes the option of difference and non-difference, there is self-contradiction. This is stated in two verses beginning with non-difference.

analyzed: bhedamardī iti iti kvacid pāṭhaḥ
translated: In some places, the reading is bhedamardī.

analyzed: tatra iti śabdasya evam iti anena anvayaḥ iti evam iti
translated: There, the word iti is connected with evam by evam.
Bhedamardī means the destroyer of absolute difference.

original: etayoḥbhedābhedayoḥ svarūpaṃ svarūpabhedamupagamyaiva bhedo 'bhedo veti vikalpakoṭyorbādhanaṃ dūṣaṇaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: etayoḥ bheda abhedayoḥ svarūpam svarūpa bhedam upagamya eva bhedaḥ bhedaḥ vā iti vikalpa koṭyoḥ bādhanam dūṣaṇam kriyate
translated: Having accepted the nature of difference itself, the refutation of the two alternatives of difference and non-difference is done.

analyzed: tena sva abhyugamena
translated: By that, by one's own acceptance.

analyzed: vāc bādhā bhavat ukta dūṣaṇa vacana uparodhaḥ
translated: There is the contradiction of the statement of the objection that has been stated.

analyzed: prasajyate iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The rest is is entailed.

analyzed: tvam ca sva abhyupagama viruddha vacana tvena nigṛhyase iti arthaḥ
translated: And you are reproached for being one whose statement contradicts one's own acceptance.
The option of the existence or non-existence of the relation of being different and non-different,
The mere drying up of the throat is refuted by direct experience.

analyzed: bhinna abhinna tva iti
translated: Regarding being different and non-different:

analyzed: bhinna abhinna tvasya dharmiṇā sambandhaḥ sti na vā
translated: Is there a relation between the property and being different and non-different, or not?

analyzed: ādye tad sambandhe sambandha antaram vācyam
translated: If the first, even in that relation, another relation must be stated.

analyzed: tatra api tathā iti anavasthā
translated: There also, it would be the same, so there is an infinite regress.

original: antye asambaddhasya viśiṣṭabuddhinirvāhakatvaṃ tasya na syāditi vikalpanamapi kaṇṭhaśoṣaṇamātraphalakaṃ pratyakṣānubhavabādhitaṃ cetyarthaḥ
analyzed: antye asambaddhasya viśiṣṭa buddhi nirvāhaka tvam tasya na syāt iti vikalpanam api kaṇṭha śoṣaṇa mātra phalakam pratyakṣa anubhava bādhitam ca iti arthaḥ
translated: If the last, it would not be the cause of the cognition of the qualified, being unrelated. Thus, the option is also merely the result of drying up the throat, and is refuted by direct experience. This is the meaning.

analyzed: nīle nīla matiḥ yādṛś utpale nīla dhīḥ hi sā
translated: As the cognition of blue is in the blue lotus, so is the cognition of blue.

analyzed: nīlam utpalam eva idam iti sākṣāt cakāsti naḥ  /
translated: And this is indeed a blue lotus clearly appears to us.

analyzed: nīlā eti
translated: Regarding blue:

original: nīlarūpavati ghaṭādau nīlabuddhiryathā nīlasamavāyāvagāhinī viditā nāpalapyā /
analyzed: nīla rūpavati ghaṭa ādau nīla buddhiḥ yathā nīla samavāya avagāhinī viditā na apalapyā
translated: As the cognition of blue in a pot, etc. that possess blue is known to penetrate the inherence of blue and cannot be denied.

analyzed: evam nīlam utpalam iti vidita aprasiddhā nīla tādātmya matiḥ api nā apalapyā
translated: Similarly, the cognition of the identity of blue cannot be denied, even though it is known as this is a blue lotus.

analyzed: sva para nirvāhaka samādhinā svarūpa sambandhena vā anavasthā parihāryā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that the infinite regress is to be avoided by the relation of its own nature, or by the concentration that accomplishes its own and others'.

analyzed: yathā vidita saṃyoga sambandhe pi akṣa gocare
translated: As in the case of the sense object, even though the relation of conjunction is known,

analyzed: bheda abheda ādi dustarka vikalpa ādhāna vibhramaḥ
translated: The delusion of superimposing the option of difficult reasoning such as difference and non-difference,

analyzed: tadvat tādātmya sambandhe śruti pratyakṣa mūlake
translated: Based on the relation of identity and inherence, which have the scriptures and perception as their basis,
The delusion of the option of difficult reasoning is warded off by the rod of the scriptures.

analyzed: tādātmya sambandha vidveṣi prayuktānām dustarkāṇām pratyakṣa śāstra parāhata tvam eva prapañcayati yathā iti
translated: He elaborates on the fact that the difficult reasonings employed by those who hate the relation of identity are refuted by perception and the scriptures, saying yathā (as).

analyzed: saṃyoge bheda abhedāt ituḥ tarkaḥ yathā abhinnayoḥ saṃyoge uta abhinnayoḥ
translated: The difficult reasoning of difference and non-difference in conjunction is like this: Is conjunction of different things or of non-different things?

analyzed: ādye himavat vindhyayoḥ api saṃyoga prasaṅgaḥ
translated: In the first case, there would be the consequence of conjunction even between the Himalayas and the Vindhyas.

analyzed: antye svena eva svasya saḥ
translated: In the second case, it is with itself alone.

analyzed: saṃyogaḥ dharmiṇaḥ bhinnaḥ na vā
translated: Is conjunction different from the substratum or not?

analyzed: bhede tasya api sambandha antaram tasya api tathā iti anavasthā
translated: If different, then there would be an infinite regress of other relations for that also.

analyzed: abhede saṃyogaḥ eva na sidhyati ityādiḥ
translated: If not different, then conjunction itself is not established. And so on.

original: sphuṭapratipanne saṃyoge dustarkatanmūlavikalpanādi yathā bhramalakṣaṇaṃ kaṇṭhaśoṣaṇamātram /
analyzed: sphuṭa pratipanne saṃyoge dustarka tad mūla vikalpana ādi yathā bhrama lakṣaṇam kaṇṭha śoṣaṇa mātram
translated: When conjunction is clearly understood, the superimposition of difficult reasoning based on that and the option etc. are merely a throat-drying due to delusion.

analyzed: pratyakṣa parāhatam ca
translated: And it is also refuted by perception.

original: evaṃ nīlotpalāditādātmye pratyakṣe jīvabrahmatādātmye ca śāstrasiddhe dustarkavikalpanādi pratyakṣaśāstradaṇḍanivāritamiti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: evam nīlotpala ādi tādātmye pratyakṣe jīva brahma tādātmye ca śāstra siddhe dustarka vikalpana ādi pratyakṣa śāstra daṇḍa nivāritam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Thus, in the identity of the blue lotus etc., which is perceived, and in the identity of the individual soul and Brahman, which is established by the scriptures, the false conceptualization by difficult reasoning is prevented by the rod of perception and scripture.

analyzed: śruti daṇḍena iti prakṛta tattvamasi vākya artha abhiprāyeṇa uktam
translated: The phrase by the rod of the Veda is used with the intention of the meaning of the statement That art thou which is the subject matter.

analyzed: ca śrutiḥ atyartham ādarāt
translated: The Veda, which is free from defects and is not of human origin, states the truth repeatedly with great respect.

analyzed: asakṛt tattvam iti āha tādātmyam brahma jīvāyoḥ  jīva parayoḥ dātmye bhyāsa rūpam tātparya liṅgam api asti iti āha
translated: It says that the identity of the individual soul and Brahman is the truth.🔽There is also an indication of the purport in the form of repetition in the identity of the individual soul and the supreme self. It is said that the Veda is free from defects.

original: pravṛttinimittarūpadharmabhedena dharmisvarūpābhedena ca tādātmyaṃ tattvamasītyādau tvamādiśabdānāṃ tattaccharīrakabrahmaparyantatayā nirūpaṇīyam
analyzed: pravṛtti nimitta rūpa dharma bhedena dharmi svarūpa abhedena ca tādātmyam tat tvam asi ityādau tvam ādi śabdānām tad tad śarīraka brahma paryanta tayā nirūpaṇīyam
translated: The identity should be determined in statements like That thou art by the words thou etc. up to the Brahman of that particular body, by the difference in the nature of the attribute which is the cause of activity, and by the non-difference in the nature of the substance.

analyzed: tad ādi padānām brahma ātmaka para tayā vā
translated: Or by the meaning of the words that etc. as Brahman and the self.
But in the opinion of Yādava Prakāśa and others, the difference and non-difference are only in the nature of the individual soul and Brahman. This is the distinction.

analyzed: brahma ānanda hrada antar sthaḥ mukta ātmā sukham edhate
translated: The liberated self, dwelling in the lake of the bliss of Brahman, prospers in happiness.

analyzed: phale ca phalinaḥ bhāvāt mokṣasya a puruṣa artha tā
translated: And because there is no existence of the fruit in the fruit, liberation is not a human goal.

original: ekaśeṣe hi ciddhātoḥ kasya mokṣaḥ phalaṃ bhavet // //🔽iti paramate sāmānādhikaraṇyārthāyogavarṇanam
analyzed: eka śeṣe hi cit dhātoḥ kasya mokṣaḥ phalam bhavet  / iti para mate sāmānādhikaraṇya artha ayoga varṇanam
translated: For in the coalescence of the one, which is the essence of consciousness, whose liberation could be the fruit?🔽Thus is described the incompatibility of co-reference in the opponent's view.

original: etāvatā paramate prātipadikayoriva samānavibhakterapi na mukhyārthateti vyavasthāpitam /
analyzed: etāvatā para mate prātipadikayoḥ iva samāna vibhakteḥ api na mukhya artha tā iti vyavasthāpitam
translated: So far it has been established that even in the opponent's view, the meaning of the same case ending is not primary, just like the meanings of the two words.

analyzed: yadi api abheda mātrasya samāna vibhakti artha tvam sambhavati
translated: Even though the meaning of the same case ending is possible as mere non-difference,

original: tathāpi pravṛttinimittadharmabhedaprahāṇānna sāmānādhikaraṇyamukhyārthatā paramata iti bodhyam /
analyzed: tathā api pravṛtti nimitta dharma bheda prahāṇāt na sāmānādhikaraṇya mukhya artha tā paramatas iti bodhyam
translated: nevertheless, it should be understood that co-reference does not have a primary meaning in the opponent's view due to the abandonment of the difference of attributes that are the causes of usage.

analyzed: atha cit mātra pariśeṣe pi na yuktaḥ
translated: Now, even in the remainder of mere consciousness, it is not proper.

analyzed: tathā sati mokṣasya a puruṣa artha tā prasakteḥ iti āha brahma iti
translated: In that case, there is the possibility of liberation not being a human goal, so he says Brahman and so on.

original: eṣa brahma praviṣṭo 'smi grīṣme śītamiva hradam itivacanānusāreṇa brahmānandasya hradatvarūpaṇam /
analyzed: eṣa brahma praviṣṭaḥ smi grīṣme śītam iva hradam iti vacana anusāreṇa brahmānandasya hrada tva rūpaṇam
translated: In accordance with the statement I have entered this Brahman, like cool water in summer, Brahman is likened to a lake.

analyzed: sakala saṃsāra tāpa kleśa hara tvāt niratiśaya āhlāda kara tvāt ca tasya
translated: This is because it removes all the afflictions of worldly heat and because it gives incomparable bliss.

original: brahmānandaṃ hṛdantaḥstha iti pūrvamudritapāṭhastu na samīcīnaḥ /
analyzed: brahma ānandam hṛd antar sthaḥ iti pūrva mudrita pāṭhaḥ tu na samīcīnaḥ
translated: The reading Brahman's bliss resides within the heart as printed earlier is not correct.

analyzed: mukta ātmā aparicchinna brahma ānanda sāgare nimagnaḥ nitya pravṛddha sukhaḥ varīvartitarām iti śāstra maryādā
translated: The scriptural limit is that one is immersed in the ocean of Brahman's bliss, which is unlimited for the liberated self, and is of ever-increasing happiness, like a floating log.

original: paramaphale mokṣe bhoktṛtvāvasthāpannasya svasya vilayaṃ cejjānīyānnābhilaṣyettāmityarthaḥ /
analyzed: parama phale mokṣe bhoktṛ tva avasthā āpannasya svasya vilayam ced jānīyāt na abhilaṣyet tām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that if one were to know that one's own state of being the enjoyer in the supreme fruit of liberation would be destroyed, one would not desire it.

analyzed: eka śeṣe nirviśeṣa cit mā tra pariśeṣe
translated: In the one-residue, in the remainder of non-distinct consciousness,

analyzed: kasya brahmaṇaḥ jīvasya vā mokṣaḥ phalam
translated: whose liberation is the fruit - of Brahman or of the individual soul?

analyzed: na brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Not of Brahman.

analyzed: nitya mukta tvāt
translated: Because it is eternally liberated.

analyzed: na api jīvasya
translated: Nor of the individual soul.

analyzed: tasya eva tadā vilayāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that because it would be destroyed at that time itself.

original: cinmātrameva brahma jīvasya svarūpamiti cettarhi brahmaṇa evāvidyājīvabhāvādi vaktavyam /
analyzed: cit mātram eva brahma jīvasya svarūpam iti ced tarhi brahmaṇaḥ eva avidyā jīva bhāva ādi vaktavyam
translated: If consciousness alone is Brahman and the nature of the individual soul, then the state of ignorance, individual soul, etc. of Brahman itself should be stated.

analyzed: tat ca śruti yukti parāhatam iti dhyeyam
translated: And that is contradicted by scripture and reason. This should be contemplated.

analyzed: evam avidyā parikalpita jīva īśvara tva ādi vikalpa parityāgena nirviśeṣa cit mātra aikyam tattvamasi vākya arthaḥ iti atra dūṣaṇa jātam proktam
translated: Thus, the objections to the meaning of the sentence That thou art, which is the identity of non-distinct consciousness alone, by abandoning the alternatives of individual soul and God etc. imagined by ignorance, have been stated.

analyzed: kiñca prapañca rūpeṇa kaḥ nu saṃvid vivartate
translated: Moreover, in the form of the world, what does consciousness evolve?

original: na tāvadghaṭadhīstasyāmasatyāmapi darśanāt // //🔽na hi tasyāmajātāyāṃ naṣṭāyāṃ vākhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: na tāvat ghaṭa dhīḥ tasyām asatyām api darśanāt  / na hi tasyām ajātāyām naṣṭāyām vā akhilam jagat
translated: Not the cognition of the pot, because it is seen even when it is not real.

analyzed: na asti iti śakyate vaktum uktau pratyakṣa bādhanāt
translated: For it cannot be said that when it is unborn or destroyed, the entire world does not exist, because such a statement is contradicted by perception.

analyzed: na api anya saṃvid tad nāśe pi anyeṣām upalambhanāt
translated: Nor is it the cognition of another, because others are perceived even when it is destroyed.

analyzed: atha prapañca bhrama adhiṣṭhānasya tad bhrama hetoḥ ca svarūpa vimarśena api para mate sāmañjasyam udbhāvayati kiñca ityādinā
translated: Now, in the inquiry into the nature of the basis of the illusion of the world and the cause of that illusion, even by the inquiry into its own nature, he points out the inconsistency in the highest doctrine with Moreover and so on.

analyzed: vivartate ayathākāreṇa bhāsate
translated: It evolves, it appears in an unreal form.

analyzed: darśanāt bheda prapañcasya dṛṣṭeḥ
translated: Because of being seen, because of the appearance of the manifold world.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānam antar āropya pratīti ayogāt na ghaṭa paṭa ādi dhiyām āgama apāyinīnām prapañca bhrama adhiṣṭhāna tvam sambhavati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that without a basis, the manifold world cannot be cognized, and therefore the cognitions of pot, cloth, etc., which come and go, cannot be the basis of the illusion of the world.
The world is the manifold of differences.

analyzed: tad bhānam iti yāvat
translated: That is, it is the appearance of that.

analyzed: na api iti
translated: Nor is it the cognition of another.

original: paṭajñānanāśe 'pi anyeṣāṃ ghaṭādibhedānāmupalambhānna paṭajñānāderapi prapañcādhyāsādhiṣṭhānatvaṃ saṃbhavatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: paṭa jñāna nāśe pi anyeṣām ghaṭa ādi bhedānām upalambhāt na paṭa jñāna ādeḥ api prapañca adhyāsa adhiṣṭhāna tvam saṃbhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: Even when the cognition of cloth is destroyed, other things like pots are perceived. Therefore, the cognition of cloth and other things cannot be the basis of the superimposition of the world.

analyzed: saṃvid eva prapañca bhrama adhiṣṭhānam iti pareṣām matam
translated: The view of others is that consciousness itself is the basis of the illusion of the world.

analyzed: tatra ghaṭa paṭa ādi saṃvidām na adhiṣṭhāna tvam sambhavati iti uktam bhavati
translated: It is said that the cognitions of pot, cloth, etc. cannot be the basis.

original: nanu saṃvidabhinnaikā na tasyāmasti bhedadhīḥ /🔽ghaṭādayo hi bhidyante na tu sā cit prakāśanāt // //
analyzed: nanu saṃvid abhinnā ekā na tasyām asti bheda dhīḥ  ghaṭa ādayaḥ hi bhidyante na tu sā cit prakāśanāt
translated: But consciousness is not different and one, so there is no cognition of difference in it.🔽It is only pots, etc. that are different, not that consciousness, because it is luminous.

analyzed: ghaṭa dhīḥ paṭa saṃvitti samaye na avabhāti ced
translated: If the cognition of the pot does not appear at the time of the cognition of the cloth,

original: naivaṃ / ghaṭo hi nābhāti sā sphuratyeva tu sphuṭam // //
analyzed: nā evam ghaṭaḥ hi nā ābhāti sā sphurati eva tu sphuṭam
translated: No, the pot does not appear, but it clearly manifests.

original: ghaṭavyāvṛttasaṃvittiratha na sphuratīti cet /🔽tadvyāvṛttipadenāpi kiṃ saivoktātha vetarat /
analyzed: ghaṭa vyāvṛtta saṃvittiḥ atha na sphurati iti ced  tad vyāvṛtti padena api kim sā evā uktā atha vā itarat
translated: If it is said that the cognition excluded from the pot does not manifest,🔽Is that same consciousness stated by the exclusion of that or something else?

analyzed: sā eva ced bhāsate brūmaḥ tasya bhāsanam
translated: If it is the same, then we do not say that it manifests as something else.

analyzed: atra pareṣām āśaṅkā ananu iti
translated: Here, the doubt of others is not appropriate.

analyzed: akhaṇḍā saṃvid ekā nityā a vibhvī ca
translated: Undivided consciousness is one, eternal and all-pervading.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādīnām eva anya jñāneṣu abhāsamānānām bhedaḥ
translated: The difference is only of pots, etc. that appear in other cognitions.

analyzed: saṃvidaḥ tu sarva jñāneṣu prakāśamāna tvāt eka tvam eva
translated: But consciousness, being manifest in all cognitions, is one only.

analyzed: tasyām bheda buddhiḥ tu aupādhika viṣayā na yathārtha saṃvid svarūpa bheda viṣayā
translated: The notion of difference in it pertains to adjuncts, not to the real nature of consciousness.

analyzed: sā eva prapañca bhrama adhiṣṭhānam bhavati
translated: That itself is the basis of the illusion of the world.

analyzed: ghaṭa buddhiḥ paṭa jñāna kāle na bhāsate
translated: The cognition of the pot does not appear at the time of the cognition of the cloth.

analyzed: kintu paṭa dhīḥ evā iti ced mā evam
translated: But only the cognition of the cloth, if it be so, it is not so.

analyzed: tadā ghaṭaḥ eva na bhāsate
translated: At that time, the pot itself does not appear.

analyzed: jñānam tu bhāsate eva
translated: But the cognition does appear.

original: nanu ghaṭaviṣayakatvaviśiṣṭasaṃvidaḥ paṭajñāne 'bhānamiti cet / maivam /🔽ghaṭaviṣayakatvarūpaṃ ghaṭavyāvṛttattvamapi saṃvitsvarūpameva /
analyzed: nanu ghaṭa viṣayaka tva viśiṣṭa saṃvidaḥ paṭa jñāne bhānam iti ced mā evam                     eva
translated: If it be said that the consciousness qualified by the objectness of the pot does not appear in the cognition of the cloth, it is not so.🔽The form of the pot, which is the objectness of the pot, is also the very form of consciousness.

analyzed: atas paṭa jñāne tasya bhānam eva
translated: Therefore, its appearance is itself in the cognition of the cloth.

analyzed: ghaṭaḥ param na bhāsate
translated: But the pot does not appear.

original: tasyātiriktatve tu paṭajñāne tadabhāne 'pi saṃvidobhānamakṣatameveti samuditāśayaḥ // // // //
analyzed: tasya atirikta tve tu paṭa jñāne tad abhāne pi saṃvidaḥ bhānam akṣatam eva iti samudita āśayaḥ
translated: But if it were different from that, even if it did not appear in the cognition of the cloth, the appearance of consciousness would remain intact. This is the combined idea.

original: kiñcāsyāḥ svaprakāśāyā nīrūpāyā na hi svataḥ /
