translated: Here he raises the doubt in simultaneity etc.🔽Exclusion is the apprehension of difference.

analyzed: vidhānam svarūpa grahaṇam
translated: Affirmation is the apprehension of the form.

analyzed: prātyakṣika pramiteḥ yugapad eva adhikaraṇa tad niṣṭha bheda ubhaya grāhi tvam na sambhavati
translated: The simultaneous apprehension of the locus and the difference based on it is not possible for perceptual cognition.

analyzed: adhikaraṇa grahaṇasya pratiyogi graṇa nairapekṣyāt
translated: Because the apprehension of the locus does not depend on the apprehension of the counter-correlate.

analyzed: bheda grahaṇasya tu tad sāpekṣa tvāt
translated: But the apprehension of difference depends on that.

original: prathamamadhikaraṇasvarūpaṃ gṛhītvāthaṃ bhedaṃ gṛhṇātīti kramo 'pi na sambhavati /
analyzed: prathamam adhikaraṇa sva rūpam bhedam gṛhṇāti iti na sambhavati
translated: The sequence that first the form of the locus is grasped, then the difference is also not possible.

analyzed: pramiteḥ kṣaṇika tvāt viramya vyāpāra ayogāt vā
translated: Because cognition is momentary, or because it cannot operate with interruption.

analyzed: svarūpa bhedayoḥ tad grahaṇayoḥ ca aikyam api na sambhavati
translated: And the identity of the two, the difference in form and the apprehension of that, is also not possible.

analyzed: atas svarūpa grahasya eva pratyakṣa pramiti rūpa tvam
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of form itself is of the nature of perception.

analyzed: bheda grahasya tu bhrānti lakṣaṇa tvam eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But the apprehension of difference is only of the nature of error. This is the idea.

analyzed: śaṅkām pratikṣipati imām iti tyādinā
translated: He rejects this doubt with the words iti etc.

analyzed: bhedaḥ nyonya abhāvaḥ  itaretara abhāvaḥ anyasmin anyasya saṃsarga abhāvaḥ
translated: Difference is mutual absence.🔽Mutual absence is the absence of contact of one thing in another.

analyzed: yat vā bhedaḥ saṃsārga abhāva bhedaḥ prāgabhāva ādiḥ
translated: Or, difference is the difference of absence of contact, such as prior absence etc.

analyzed: bhedaḥ
translated: Mutual absence is difference.

original: tayoḥ svarūpayāthātmyājñānaprayukto niruktavidhaḥ pareṣāṃ bhrama ityarthaḥ // // //
analyzed: tayoḥ svarūpa yāthātmya ajñāna prayuktaḥ nirukta vidhaḥ pareṣām bhramaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The delusion of others, consisting of the aforementioned method, is caused by the ignorance of the true nature of those two. This is the meaning.

analyzed: svarūpam eva bhāvānām pratyakṣeṇa parisphurat
translated: The very form of things, shining forth through perception,

analyzed: bheda vyāhāra hetuḥ syāt pratiyogi vyapekṣayā
translated: would be the cause of the expression of difference, in relation to the counter-correlate.

analyzed: bhedasya yāthātmyam tāvat āha svarūpam eva iti
translated: He states the nature of difference with the words The very form etc.

analyzed: svarūpam
translated: Form is the uncommon aspect.

analyzed: tat eva gṛhyamāṇām pratiyogi smaraṇa sahakāreṇa itarasmāt bheda vyavahāra nidānam
translated: That itself, when apprehended, along with the cooperation of the recollection of the counter-correlate, is the basis for the usage of difference from another.

original: yathā kambugrīvādimattvameva ghaṭasya paṭādbheda iti bhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: yathā kambu grīvā ādimattvam eva ghaṭasya paṭāt bhedaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the very fact of having a conch-shaped neck, etc. is the difference of the pot from the cloth.

analyzed: yathā tanmātra dhīḥ nānā nāstivyāhāra sādhanī
translated: Just as the cognition of mere that is the means of expressing the existence of various things,

analyzed: hrasva dīrgha tva bhedāḥ vā yathā ekatra ṣaṣ aṅgule
translated: Or just as the difference of short and long is in one thing, six inches.

analyzed: atra nidarśanam yathā iti
translated: Here, the example is stated by just as.

original: yathā bhūtalasvarūpajñānameva ghaṭādyanupalambhe sati tattatsmaraṇasahakāri ghaṭādiśūnyatāvyavahārasādhanaṃ matamabhāvasyādhikaraṇasvarūpatvavādināṃ
analyzed: yathā bhū tala svarūpa jñānam eva ghaṭa ādi anupalambhe sati tat tat smaraṇa sahakāri ghaṭa ādi śūnyatā vyavahāra sādhanam matam abhāvasya adhikaraṇa svarūpa tva vādinām
translated: Just as the knowledge of the nature of the ground itself, in the absence of the perception of pot, etc., is considered to be the means of expressing the absence of pot, etc., along with the recollection of each, by those who say that absence is of the nature of the locus,

analyzed: tathā iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is in that way.

analyzed: siddhānte tu adhikaraṇa vṛtti dharma viśeṣa rūpatvam bheda ādeḥ iti vivekaḥ
translated: But in the established conclusion, the difference, etc. are of the nature of a particular property occurring in the locus. This is the distinction.

original: ekasyaiva pritayogibhedena nānāvyavahārasādhanatvaṃ nidarśanamukhena draḍhayati hrasve ti /
analyzed: ekasya eva prita yogi bhedena nānā vyavahāra sādhanatvam nidarśana mukhena draḍhayati hrasvāḥ iti
translated: In order to strengthen the fact that the same thing is the means of expressing various things by the difference of the cognizer, he confirms it by way of an example: short and long.

original: ekatraiva ṣaḍaṅgulimite vastuni tadapekṣayādīrghaṃ pādarthāntaramapekṣya hrasvavyavahāraṃ
analyzed: ekatra eva ṣaṣ aṅguli mite vastuni tad apekṣayā adīrgham pād artha antaram apekṣya hrasva vyavahāram
translated: In the very same limited thing of six inches, the long is in relation to that, and the short is in relation to another thing, the short usage,

original: hrasvaṃ tadapekṣya dīrghavyavahāraṃ ca tadvastujñānameva tattatpratiyogismaraṇasahakāreṇa
analyzed: hrasvam tat apekṣya dīrgha vyavahāram ca tad vastu jñānam eva tad tad pratiyogi smaraṇa sahakāreṇa
translated: and the short is in relation to that, the long usage. That very knowledge of the thing, along with the recollection of each counter-correlate,

analyzed: janayati hi iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it produces.

analyzed: evam vyavasthita aneka prakāra ākaravat tayā
translated: Thus, due to having a source of many kinds that are thus established,

analyzed: pratyakṣasya prapañcasya śakya nihnavaḥ
translated: The existence of that is undeniable for the extensive perception.

original: eva miti /🔽svarūpalakṣaṇasya bhedasyādyakṣaṇa eva dharmigrahaṇe grahasambhavādbhedavyavahāra
analyzed: evam iti  svarūpa lakṣaṇasya bhedasya ādi akṣaṇe eva dharmi grahaṇe graha sambhavāt bheda vyavahāra
translated: Thus.🔽Because the difference characterized by its own nature can be grasped in the apprehension of the characterized object at the very first moment, the usage of difference

analyzed: eva pratiyogi smaraṇasya apekṣita tvāt ca nānā ākāra vibhinna padārtha svarūpasya tattvam pratyakṣa pramāṇa pramitam
translated: is not possible without the recollection of the counter-correlate. Therefore, the reality of the nature of objects differentiated by various forms is cognized by the means of valid knowledge of perception.

analyzed: na apalapana arham iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not to be denied.

analyzed: asādhāraṇa ākāra rūpasya bhedasya sva para nirvāhaka tvāt na anavasthā
translated: There is no infinite regress because the difference in the form of the uncommon aspect serves to establish both itself and others.

analyzed: tad prāgabhāvaḥ tad pūrva avasthā rūpaḥ  dhvaṃsaḥ tad uttara avasthā rūpaḥ
translated: The prior non-existence of that is in the form of the prior state of that.🔽The destruction is in the form of the subsequent state of that.

analyzed: tad atyanta abhāvaḥ tad adhikaraṇa svabhāva viśeṣa ātmakaḥ
translated: The absolute non-existence of that is in the form of a particular nature of the substratum of that.

analyzed: sāmayika abhāvaḥ
translated: The temporary non-existence.
Is in the form of the substratum of that restricted by a particular time.

original: eṣāṃ ca tattatpratiyogyuparaktatvena vyavahāre punastattatpratiyogismaraṇāpekṣeti viveko 'tra bodhyaḥ // //
analyzed: eṣām ca tad tad pratiyogi uparakta tvena vyavahāre punar tad tad pratiyogi smaraṇa apekṣā iti vivekaḥ tra bodhyaḥ  /
translated: And it should be understood here that these are to be used as imbued with their respective counter-correlates, and again they are dependent on the recollection of those respective counter-correlates.

analyzed: āgamaḥ kārya niṣṭha tvāt īdṛśā arthe na tu pramā
translated: The scripture is not a means of valid knowledge regarding such a matter, because it is concerned with effects.

analyzed: prāmāṇye pi anvaya ayogya padārtha tvāt na bodhakaḥ
translated: Even if it were a means of valid knowledge, it would not be a means of knowing that, because the meaning of the words is not fit to be connected.

original: evaṃ bhedaprapañcasya sattva eva pratyakṣaṃ pramāṇam /
analyzed: evam bheda prapañcasya sattvaḥ eva pratyakṣam pramāṇam
translated: Thus, perception is the only means of valid knowledge regarding the existence of the manifold world.

analyzed: na sat asat anirvacanīya tve iti sthāpitam
translated: It has been established that it is not regarding the inexpressible nature of the existent and non-existent.

original: śāstrasyāpi na tatra prāṇāṇyamityāha āgama iti /
analyzed: śāstrasya api na tatra prāṇāṇyam iti āha āgamaḥ iti
translated: He says that the scripture also has no authority in that matter.

analyzed: āgamaḥ śāstram
translated: Scripture means the sacred texts.

analyzed: kārya niṣṭha tvāt kārya artha pratipādana tatpara tvāt
translated: Because it is concerned with effects, because it is devoted to teaching the purpose of effects.

analyzed: kārya ananvayini siddhe prapañca anirvacanīya tva ādau
translated: Regarding such a matter, which is not connected with an effect, which is established, such as the inexpressibility of the world,

analyzed: na pramā na pramāṇam
translated: it is not a means of valid knowledge, it is not a means of knowing that.

analyzed: mīmāṃsaka matena idam
translated: This is according to the Mimamsa view.

original: siddhāntimatenāpyāha prāmāṇye 'pīti /🔽siddhārthe śāstrasya pramāṇabhāve satyapi śāstrasya pramāṇaśabdamātrasya vā nānirvacanīyatvādau pramāṇatvam /
analyzed: siddhānti matena api āha prāmāṇye pi iti  siddhārthe śāstrasya pramāṇa bhāve sati api śāstrasya pramāṇa śabda mātrasya vā na anirvacanīya tva ādau pramāṇa tvam
translated: According to the view of the Siddhantin, he says even if it were a means of valid knowledge.🔽Even if the scripture is a means of valid knowledge regarding what is already known, the mere word means of valid knowledge or the scripture itself is not a means of knowing the inexpressible nature, etc.

analyzed: na san na api asān ityādeḥ ananvita arthaka tvena śabda bodha ajanaka tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it does not generate the understanding of the word, because it has a meaning that is not connected, such as not existent and not non-existent.

original: tat tatpratipādakatayeva pratīyamāno 'pi sandarbho 'viruddhārthaparatayā neya iti hārdam // //
analyzed: tat tad pratipādaka tayā iva pratīyamānaḥ api sandarbhaḥ viruddha artha para tayā neyaḥ iti hārdam
translated: Although the text is understood as expressing just that, it is to be interpreted as having a meaning that is not contradictory, this is the heart of the matter.

analyzed: na asat pratīteḥ
translated: Not non-existent, because of cognition.

analyzed: bādhāt ca na sat iti api yat na tat
translated: And also not existent because of contradiction - that is not so.

analyzed: pratīteḥ eva sat kim na
translated: Is it not existent because of cognition itself?

analyzed: bādhāt na asat kutas jagat
translated: How can the world be non-existent because of contradiction?

original: tasmādavidyayaiveyamavidyā bhavatā'śritā // //🔽athānumānasyāpi sadasadanirvacanīyatve na pramāṇatvamityāha nāsa diti /
analyzed: tasmāt avidyayā eva iyam avidyā bhavatā āśritā    atha anumānasya api sat asat anirvacanīya tve na pramāṇa tvam iti āha na asat iti
translated: Therefore, this ignorance is resorted to by you only through ignorance itself.🔽Now, if even inference has the nature of being inexpressible as existent or non-existent, it is not a means of valid knowledge. He says not non-existent etc.

original: prapañcaḥ sadasadbhinnaḥ pratīyamānatve sati bādhyamānatvāditi yuktirapi na satī /
analyzed: prapañcaḥ sat asat bhinnaḥ pratīyamāna tve sati bādhyamāna tvāt iti yuktiḥ api na satī
translated: The argument that the world is different from existent and non-existent because of being cognized and being contradicted is also not true.

original: prapañca sadasattvavān tata evetyābhāsa samānayogakṣematvāditi bhāvaḥ /
translated: The meaning is that the world has the nature of being both existent and non-existent for the same reason, and is thus similar in being equally safe or unsafe.

analyzed: nirupādhika sattva asattvayoḥ virodhaḥ trā abhipretaḥ
translated: Here, the contradiction between unqualified existence and non-existence is intended.

analyzed: tasmāt diti
translated: Therefore.

analyzed: anirvacanīya tvasya aprāṇāṇika tvāt tad upapādaka avidyā kalpanam bhavat ajñāna kāryam eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the postulation of ignorance as an explanation for inexpressibility is only the effect of your ignorance.

analyzed: kiñca bheda prapañcasya dharmaḥ mithyātva lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of falsity of the world of differences,

original: mithyā vā paramārtho vā nādyaḥ kalpo 'yamañjasā // //
analyzed: mithyā vā parama arthaḥ vā na ādyaḥ kalpaḥ yam añjasā
translated: The first alternative is not correct, because it is too wide.

analyzed: tad mithyātve prapañcasya satya tvam durapahnavam
translated: If the world is false, its reality is undeniable.

analyzed: tena eva tava advaitam vihanyate  /
translated: Even by its reality, your non-dualism is contradicted.

analyzed: iti prapañcasya sat asat vyatireki tva rūpa mithyātva nirasanam
translated: Thus ends the refutation of the form of falsity of the world as being different from existence and non-existence.

original: pramāṇābhāvāddūṣitaṃ sadasadanirvacanīyatvarūpaṃ mithyātvaṃ prakārāntareṇāpi dūṣayati kiñceti /
analyzed: pramāṇa abhāvāt dūṣitam sat asat anirvacanīya tva rūpam mithyātvam prakāra antareṇa api dūṣayati kiñca iti
translated: The falsity in the form of being inexpressible as existent or non-existent, which has been refuted due to the absence of valid means of knowledge, is refuted in another way by saying and also because...

analyzed: bheda mithyātvasya mithyātve bhedasya satya tvam siddham
translated: If the falsity of difference is false, the truth of difference is established.

analyzed: bheda mithyātvasya satya tve brahma bhinnasya api kasyacid satya tva upagamāt apasiddhāntaḥ dvaita vyāghātaḥ ca iti arthaḥ
translated: If the falsity of difference is true, then the truth of something different from Brahman is accepted, leading to the fallacy of contradicting one's own doctrine and the contradiction of non-dualism. This is the meaning.

original: naca bhedamithyātvaṃ satyaṃ brahmasvarūpameveti nādvaitahānyādīti vācyam //
analyzed: na ca bheda mithyātvam satyam brahma svarūpam eva iti na advaita hāni ādi iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the falsity of difference is true and is the nature of Brahman itself, so there is no loss of non-dualism, etc.

analyzed: tathā asati brahmaṇaḥ mithyā vastu guṇa tva prasaṅgāt iti anyatra vistaraḥ
translated: Because in that case, it would lead to the absurdity of Brahman having the quality of a false object. This has been explained in detail elsewhere.

analyzed: sarvāṇi eva pramāṇāni svam svam artham yathā uditam
translated: All the means of valid knowledge, each in its own way, establish the existence of Brahman, which is the object of the Upaniṣads.

analyzed: asataḥ ṛtha antarebhyaḥ ca vyavacchindanti bhānti na
translated: And they appear as excluding from non-existent other things.

original: evaṃ mithyātvaṃ nirasya bhedaprapañcasya satyatvaṃ vyavasthāpayan parābhimataṃ sadadvaitaṃ pratikṣeptumupakramate sarvāṇyeveti /
analyzed: evam mithyātvam nirasya bheda prapañcasya satya tvam vyavasthāpayan para abhimatam sat advaitam pratikṣeptum upakramate sarvāṇi eva iti
translated: Thus having refuted falsity, establishing the truth of the manifold of difference, he begins to refute the non-dual existence accepted by others, saying all etc.

analyzed: yathoditam iti atra yathāyatham iti syāt vā
translated: As stated - here as it is or as it is may be.

analyzed: yathā uditam iti asya na pratyakṣa ādeḥ anirvacanīya pratyāyaka tvam ati pūrva nirūpita anatikrameṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of as stated is not that perception etc. are the inducers of the indescribable, but that they do not go beyond what has been determined before.

analyzed: tathā hi iha ghaṭaḥ sti iti yā iyam dhīḥ upajāyate
translated: Thus, indeed, here this cognition arises: The pot exists.

original: sā tadā tasya nābhāvaṃ paṭatvaṃ vānumanyate // //
analyzed: sā tadā tasya na abhāvam paṭa tvam vā anumanyate
translated: It does not admit the non-existence of that [pot] or the nature of a cloth.

analyzed: sva sva prameyasya asataḥ bhāvāt bhāva antarebhyaḥ ca vyāvṛtta ākāra tā pratyāyaka tvam pramāṇānām prasiddham iti yat uktam
translated: It has been said that the means of valid knowledge are well-known to induce the form of exclusion from non-existent own objects and from other existents.

analyzed: tat eva upapādayati tathā hi ihe ti
translated: He explains that very [fact] with Thus, indeed, here etc.

original: ihedānīṃ ghaṭo 'stīti pratītistadānīṃ tatra svāsādhāraṇākāreṇa ghaṭasya sattāmevāvagāhate /
analyzed: iha idānīm ghaṭaḥ sti iti pratītiḥ tadānīm tatra sva asādhāraṇa ākāreṇa ghaṭasya sattām eva avagāhate
translated: Here now, the cognition The pot exists at that time only comprehends the existence of the pot by its own uncommon form.

analyzed: na abhāvam na asattām
translated: It does not admit non-existence, non-being.

original: na vā paṭatvādyarthāntaradharmavattāmityaryarthaḥ /🔽tathā cāsadvyāvṛttaṃ sadantaravyāvṛttaṃ ca vastunaḥ santaṃ ghaṭādikameva pratipādayanti pratītayaḥ ghaṭo 'sti /
analyzed: na vā paṭa tva ādi artha antara dharmavat tām iti ari arthaḥ  tathā ca asat vyāvṛttam sat antara vyāvṛttam ca vastunaḥ santam ghaṭa ādikam eva pratipādayanti pratītayaḥ ghaṭaḥ sti
translated: Or, the meaning is: because of being different from the nature of cloth etc.

analyzed: paṭaḥ sti ityādayaḥ iti sat nānātvam eva sidhyati
translated: And thus, the cognitions that convey the existent thing like a pot, which is excluded from the non-existent and excluded from other existents, by saying the pot exists, the cloth exists, etc., only establish the plurality of the existent.

original: na sadadvaitamiti bhāvaḥ // //🔽nanvastīti yaduktaṃ kiṃ tanmātraṃ ghaṭa ityapi /
analyzed: na sat advaitam iti bhāvaḥ  nanu asti iti yat uktam kim tanmātram ghaṭaḥ iti api
translated: The idea is: not the non-duality of the existent.

analyzed: artha antaram vā
translated: Now, what was said as exists, is that mere existence, or is it something different?

analyzed: tanmātre sat advaitam prasajyate
translated: If it is mere existence, then the duality of the existent is established.

original: arthāntaratve siddhaṃ tat sadasadbhyāṃ vilakṣaṇam // //🔽atra codayati nanvastīti /
analyzed: artha antara tve siddham tat sat asadbhyām vilakṣaṇam  atra codayati nanu asti iti
translated: If it is something different, then that is established as distinct from the existent and the non-existent.

analyzed: ghaṭa paṭa ādi padena api asti iti uktam sanmātram ucyate ced siddham sat dvaitam
translated: Here, he raises the objection: Now, if by the words 'the pot', 'the cloth', etc., mere existence is stated, then the duality of the existent is established.

original: stor'thāntaraṃ cettena bodhyate tarhi ghaṭāderāpatitaṃ sadasada nirvācya tvam pratītibalāccāsadvyāvṛttiriti bhāvaḥ // //🔽yadyevamasti brahmeti brahmaupaniṣadaṃ matam /
analyzed: ced tena bodhyate tarhi ghaṭa ādeḥ āpatitam pratīti balāt ca asat vyāvṛttiḥ iti bhāvaḥ  / yadi evam asti brahma iti brahmaupaniṣadam matam
translated: If it is conveyed by that as something different, then for the pot, etc., the inexpressibility as existent, non-existent, or indescribable would follow. And by the force of cognition, there would be exclusion from the non-existent. This is the idea.

analyzed: ghaṭa vat sat asadbhyām anirvācyam tava āpatet
translated: If it is so, then the Upanisadic text about Brahman, Brahman exists, would imply that Brahman is inexpressible as existent or non-existent like a pot.

analyzed: etat dūṣayati yadi evam iti
translated: This he refutes by saying 'If it is so'.

original: asti brahme tyupaniṣatpratipādyamapi brahmatulyanayātsadasadanirvacanīyaṃ prasajyate ityarthaḥ // //
analyzed: asti brahma iti upaniṣad pratipādyam api brahma tulya nayāt sat asat anirvacanīyam prasajyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even Brahman, which is taught by the Upanishads, becomes subject to the same dilemma of being indescribable as existent and non-existent, due to the same reasoning applied to Brahman.

analyzed: ānanda satya jñāna ādi nirdeśauḥ eva vaidikaiḥ
translated: The Vedantins have indeed declared Brahman to be bliss, truth, knowledge, etc.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pi atathābhāvaḥ tvayā eva evam samarthitaḥ
translated: You yourself have thus established that Brahman is not so (i.e., not mere bliss, etc.).

original: evaṃ sarvatra samānādhikaraṇavākye 'nabhimataviruddhākāraprasaṅga ityāha ānandeti /🔽ānando brahmetyādau ānandādimātraṃ brahmapadenocyate cetpadāntarāmnānavaiyarthyam /
analyzed: evam sarvatra samāna adhikaraṇa vākye na abhimata viruddha ākāra prasaṅgaḥ iti āha ānanda iti  ānandaḥ brahma ityādau ānanda ādi mātram brahma padena ucyate ced pada antar āmnāna vaiyarthyam
translated: Thus, in every sentence where the subject is the same, there is the undesirable consequence of a contradictory form. He says 'in bliss', etc.🔽If mere bliss, etc. is denoted by the word 'Brahman' in 'bliss is Brahman', etc., then the mention of other words is pointless.

analyzed: tad atirikta bodhane tu ānanda anānanda vilakṣaṇa tva ādi brahmaṇaḥ prasajyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that if something other than that is taught, then it is implied that Brahman is different from bliss and non-bliss, etc.

analyzed: ānanda padena anānanda vyāvṛttiḥ brahma padena ca ānanda vyāvṛttiḥ bhavet iti yāvat
translated: The meaning is that by the word 'bliss', there would be exclusion of non-bliss, and by the word 'Brahman', there would be exclusion of bliss.
'Not so' means not being bliss, etc.

analyzed: sat asat vyatireka uktiḥ prapañcasya ca hīyate
translated: The statement of the universe being beyond existence and non-existence is lost.

analyzed: yat yathā akiñcid ucyeta tat sarvasya tathā bhavet
translated: If something is said to be so in some way, then it would be so for everything.

original: parasyāniṣṭāntaraṃ ca prasañjayati sadasa diti /🔽sadasadvyatiriktaḥ prapañca ityapi svārthātpracyaveta /
analyzed: parasya aniṣṭa antaram ca prasañjayati sat asat iti  sat asat vyatiriktaḥ prapañcaḥ iti api svārthāt pracyaveta
translated: And he extends the undesirable consequence to the other, saying existence and non-existence.🔽He would also deviate from his own purpose by saying that the world is different from existence and non-existence.

analyzed: nirukta rītyā sat asat vyatirikta anyatvam eva prapañcasya sidhyet iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that according to the stated method, the world would be established as being different from existence and non-existence.

analyzed: yaḥ d iti
translated: Yat means.

analyzed: yat kiñcid api vastu yathā yena prakāreṇa ucyate
translated: Whatever thing is said in whatever way,

original: tasya sarvasya tathā tvadupadarśitarītyā tatprakārarāhityaṃ prasajyatā ityarthaḥ // //
analyzed: tasya sarvasya tathā tvad upadarśita rītyā tad prakāra rāhityam prasajyatā iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that the absence of that mode is implied for all of that in that way, according to the method shown by you.

analyzed: tasmāt asti iti saṃvittiḥ jāyamānā ghaṭa ādiṣu
translated: Therefore, the cognition of existence arising in pots and so on,
informs about the reality of the arrangement of those individual objects.

analyzed: ghaṭaḥ sti ityādau sattā mātrasya viśeṣya tvam
translated: In the statement the pot exists and so on, the qualification is only of existence.

original: tatra ghaṭāderbhedasyāropitatvaṃ ca parābhimataṃ pratikṣipanniva svābhimatārthaṃ pratipādayati tasmāditi /
analyzed: tatra ghaṭa ādeḥ bhedasya āropita tvam ca para abhimatam pratikṣipan iva sva abhimata artham pratipādayati tasmāt iti
translated: Rejecting the other's accepted view that the difference of the pot and so on is superimposed there, he seems to present his own accepted meaning with the words therefore.

analyzed: spaṣṭaḥ ūrthaḥ  sajātīya vijātīya vyavaccheda nibandhanaiḥ
translated: The meaning is clear.🔽The state of objects is due to their own individual forms, which are based on the exclusion of what is of the same and different kinds,

original: svaiḥsvairvyavasthitai rūpaiḥ padārthānāṃ tu yā sthitiḥ /
analyzed: svaiḥ svaiḥ vyavasthitaiḥ rūpaiḥ padārthānām tu yā sthitiḥ
translated: and which are established in their own places.

original: sā sattā na svatantra'nyā tatrādvaitakathā katham // //
analyzed: sā sattā na tatra advaita kathā katham
translated: How can there be a discussion of non-duality there, where that existence is not independent of anything else?

analyzed: iti sat advaita nirāsena bheda prapañcasya pāramārthika tva samarthanam
translated: Thus, by negating the non-duality of existence, it is established that the proliferation of distinctions is real.

analyzed: sajātīye ti
translated: In the case of homogeneous things.

original: vijātīya sajātīyāntaravyāvartakena svasvāsādhāraṇākāreṇa tasya tasya padārthasya yā sthitiḥ kālasambandhaḥ pramāṇasambandho vā /
analyzed: vijātīya sajātīya antara vyāvartakena sva sva asādhāraṇa ākāreṇa tasya tasya padārthasya yā sthitiḥ kāla sambandhaḥ pramāṇa sambandhaḥ vā
translated: The existence of that and that object is its persistence by its own unique and uncommon form, which excludes other homogeneous and heterogeneous things, whether it is a relation to time or a relation to a means of knowledge.

original: sā tattatpadārthasya sattā /🔽sā ca pratipadārthaṃ vyavasthitā /
analyzed: sā tad tad padārthasya sattā  sā ca pratipadārtham vyavasthitā
translated: And that existence is established for each object.

analyzed: dhātvartha tvāt kartṛ paratantrā ca
translated: And it is dependent on the agent, because it is the meaning of the verbal root.

original: tatsattāyāṃ svatantratvamadvaitaṃ ca bhavadabhimataṃ naiva yuktamiti bhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: tad sattāyām svatantra tvam advaitam ca bhavat abhimatam na eva yuktam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that its existence, independence, and non-duality, which are accepted by you, are not at all proper.

analyzed: na ca nānāvidha ākāra pratītiḥ śakya nihnavā
translated: And the cognition of various forms cannot be denied.

analyzed: na vedyam vitti dharmaḥ syāt iti yat prāk udīritam
translated: As it was said before, the object of cognition should be a property of the cognition.

original: tenāpi sādhitaṃ kiñcit saṃvido 'sti na vā tvayā /
analyzed: tena api sādhitam kiñcid saṃvidaḥ sti na vā tvayā
translated: By that also, you have either established something about consciousness or not.

original: asti cet pakṣapātaḥ syāt na cette viphalaḥ śramaḥ // //
analyzed: asti ced pakṣapātaḥ syāt na ced te viphalaḥ śramaḥ
translated: If so, there would be partiality; if not, your effort is fruitless.

original: evaṃ prameyabhūtasannānātvaṃ vyavasthāpya pramitinānātvamapi vyavasthāpayati parābhimatacidadvaitanirāsena naceti /
analyzed: evam prameya bhūta sat nānātvam vyavasthāpya pramiti nānātvam api vyavasthāpayati para abhimata cit advaita nirāsena na ca iti
translated: Having thus established the plurality of the real objects of cognition, he now establishes the plurality of cognitions also, by refuting the non-dual consciousness accepted by others.

original: viṣayāśrayaviśeṣaiḥ pratyakṣādisvagataviśeṣaiścānubhūyamānaṃ saṃvinnānātvamapi na kṣeptuṃ śakyamityarthaḥ /
analyzed: viṣaya āśraya viśeṣaiḥ pratyakṣa ādi svagata viśeṣaiḥ ca anubhūyamānam saṃvid nānātvam api na kṣeptum śakyam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the plurality of consciousness, which is experienced through the specific objects and the specific nature of perception etc., cannot be denied.

original: atra paraiḥ saṃvido nirviśeṣatve proktamanumānamanūdya pratikṣipati na vedya miti /
analyzed: atra paraiḥ saṃvidaḥ nirviśeṣa tve proktam anumānam anūdya pratikṣipati na vedyam iti
translated: Here, he raises the inference stated by others regarding the non-distinction of consciousness and refutes it with na vedyate.

original: saṃvidi nirviśeṣatvarūpaḥ sādhyadharma upagamyate na vā /
analyzed: saṃvidi nirviśeṣa tva rūpaḥ sādhya dharmaḥ upagamyate na vā
translated: Is the property to be proved, which is the nature of non-distinction in consciousness, accepted or not?

original: upagamyate cennirnimitta ekasmin dharme pakṣapātaste prasajyate eko dharma upadamyate /
analyzed: upagamyate ced nirnimittaḥ ekasmin dharme pakṣapātaḥ te prasajyate ekaḥ dharmaḥ upadamyate
translated: If it is accepted, then you incur the fault of having an uncaused partiality towards a single property, as only one property is stated.

analyzed: anye prāmāṇikāḥ api na upadamyante iti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that other authoritative sources are not stated.

analyzed: tathā ca abhyupagata nirviśeṣa tva virodha prasaṅgaḥ iti hārdam
translated: And in that case, there is the implication of the contradiction of the accepted non-distinction. This is the heart of the matter.

analyzed: pakṣa bādhaḥ syāt iti pāṭha antaram
translated: The alternative reading is there would be contradiction of the proposition.

analyzed: na upeyate ced sādhya dharmaḥ
translated: If the property to be proved is not accepted,

analyzed: tarhi tad sādhana artha saṃrambha vaiyartham prasajyate iti arthaḥ
translated: then the effort to prove it becomes pointless. This is the meaning.

analyzed: atas sva rasa vispaṣṭa dṛṣṭa bhedāḥ tu saṃvidaḥ  yathā ratha ādibhiḥ vāhyaiḥ yathā avasthāyibhiḥ bāhyaiḥ
translated: Therefore, the cognitions which are clearly perceived as different by their own nature,🔽Do not become one with the external objects like chariots etc. which are in a certain state,

original: naikyaṃ yānti ghaṭādibhiḥ // //🔽ata iti /🔽yathā rathādibhirvāhyairnaikyaṃ yātī ti pūrvamudritapāṭho 'śuddhaḥ /
analyzed: na aikyam yānti ghaṭa ādibhiḥ  atas iti  yathā ratha ādibhiḥ vāhyaiḥ na aikyam yāti iti pūrva mudrita pāṭhaḥ śuddhaḥ
translated: Or with pots etc. which are external.

analyzed: atas saṃvid nirviśeṣa tva ādi anumāna pratikṣepāt
translated: Therefore, because the inference of the non-difference of consciousness has been refuted,

original: svarasto viṣayāśrayasvagataviśeṣairviśiṣṭā vilakṣaṇatvena sphuṭaṃ pratīyamānāḥ saṃvidaḥ yathāvasthitairvabāhyair ghaṭādibhirarthairnaikyaṃ
analyzed: svarastaḥ viṣaya āśraya svagata viśeṣaiḥ viśiṣṭāḥ vilakṣaṇa tvena sphuṭam pratīyamānāḥ saṃvidaḥ yathā avasthitaiḥ ghaṭa ādibhiḥ arthaiḥ na aikyam
translated: The cognitions which are distinguished by their own specific features which are based on objects and are clearly perceived as distinct, do not become one with the external objects like pots etc. which are in a certain state.

analyzed: vedya veditroḥ vitti abheda matam pratikṣeptum ayam upakṣepaḥ  saha upalambha niyamaḥ na khalu a ekaika saṃvidā
translated: This is a preliminary statement to refute the view of the non-difference of the object of knowledge and the knower.🔽The restriction of simultaneous apprehension does not apply to each individual cognition.

analyzed: na ced asti sa sāmānyam sarvam saṃvedana āspadam
translated: And if it does not exist, then everything with a universal is the basis of all consciousness.

analyzed: saha upalambha niyamaḥ iti
translated: The restriction of simultaneous apprehension.

original: etacchlokasyottarārdhaṃ na cāsti citisāmānyaṃ sarvasaṃvedanāspada miti vā na cidasti sasāmānyaṃ sarvasaṃvedanāspada miti vā sambhāvyate /
analyzed: etat ślokasya uttara ardham na ca asti citi sāmānyam sarva saṃvedana āspadam iti vā na cit asti sa sāmānyam sarva saṃvedana āspadam iti vā sambhāvyate
translated: The second half of this verse is not found: Or there is no universal consciousness which is the basis of all consciousness, or There is no consciousness with a universal which is the basis of all consciousness.🔽This is possible.

analyzed: saṃvidā saha eva upalabhyamāna tvāt jñeya jñātroḥ tad abhedaḥ iti na yuktam
translated: The non-difference of the object of knowledge and the knower is not correct, because they are perceived along with consciousness.

analyzed: tad tad saṃvedana viśeṣeṇa saha upalambha niyama abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no rule of being perceived along with each particular consciousness.

analyzed: ekam jñānam vinā jñāna antareṇa api artha upalabdheḥ
translated: Because an object is perceived by one cognition and also by another cognition without that cognition.

original: viśeṣeṇa sahopalambhasya vyabhicāre 'pi citsāmānyena sahopalambhaniyamo 'stīti cet /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa saha upalambhasya vyabhicāre cit sāmānyena saha upalambha niyamaḥ sti iti ced
translated: Even if there is deviation of being perceived along with a particular, if it is argued that there is a rule of being perceived along with the universal of consciousness,

analyzed: tat api na samyak
translated: that is also not correct.

analyzed: viśeṣa vyatiriktasya cit sāmānyasya eva anuvṛttasya sarva viṣaya vijñāna viṣayasya abhāvat iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is no continuing universal of consciousness separate from the particular, which is the object of all cognitions of objects.

original: yathāmudritapāṭhe tvayamarthaḥ sahopalambhaniyamo na siddhayati cet sarvaṃ sasāmānyaviseṣaṃ jñātṛjñeyātmakaṃ jñeyajātaṃ jñānabhinnatayāstyevetyarthaḥ
analyzed: yathā mudrita pāṭhe tu ayam arthaḥ saha upalambha niyamaḥ na siddhayati ced sarvam sa sāmānya viseṣam jñātṛ jñeya ātmakam jñeya jātam jñāna bhinna tayā asti eva iti arthaḥ
translated: But in the printed text, the meaning is: if the rule of being perceived together is not established, then the entire class of objects, consisting of the knower, the known, and the distinction between them, exists separately from knowledge.

analyzed: evam miti mātṛ meya bhidā yāthārthyam samarthitam bhavati
translated: Thus, the truth of the distinction between the knower, the known, and the means of knowledge is established.

original: ayaṃ ślokaḥ sahopalambhaniyamā dityādinā prapañca sphuṭamañcatī tyantena anūdyamānaparapakṣa pratikṣepabhāge susaṅgataḥ /
analyzed: ayam ślokaḥ saha upalambha niyamāḥ t ityādinā sphuṭam añcatī tyantena anūdyamāna parapakṣa pratikṣepa bhāge su saṅgataḥ
translated: This verse, beginning with because of the rule of being perceived together, and ending with the extensive explanation becomes clear, is very relevant in the section that rejects the opponent's view that is being referred to.

analyzed: tasmāt upalabhyamāna saṃvid siddhi bhāga antima śloka anantaram saṃyojanīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, it should be added immediately after the last verse which concludes the proof of the existence of consciousness that is experienced.

original: ayaṃ ca śloko jñeyajñātroḥ saṃvidaikyasādha kasahopalambhaniyamarūpahetorasiddhipratipādaka iti dhyeyam // //
analyzed: ayam ca ślokaḥ jñeya jñātroḥ saṃvid aikya sādha ka sahopalambha niyama rūpa hetoḥ asiddhi pratipādakaḥ iti dhyeyam  /
translated: And this verse should be contemplated as stating the non-establishment of the reason in the form of the rule of simultaneous apprehension, which proves the identity of consciousness between the cognizer and the cognized.

analyzed: saha upalambha niyamāt na anyaḥ arthaḥ saṃvidaḥ bhavet  yat etat apara adhīna sva prakāśam tat eva hi
translated: The object cannot be different from consciousness, because of the rule of simultaneous apprehension.🔽For that alone is said to be self-luminous, which is independent of anything else and shines by itself.

analyzed: vṛddhāḥ pracakṣate
translated: The elders call it the state of being self-luminous.

analyzed: yasmin a bhāsamāne pi yaḥ nāma arthaḥ na bhāsate
translated: That object which does not appear even when that [consciousness] appears,

analyzed: na asau artha antaraḥ taram
translated: is not a different object from it,

analyzed: smāt mithyā induḥ iva candrataḥ
translated: like the false moon from the real moon.

analyzed: a bhāsamāne vijñāne na ca ātma artha avabhāsanam
translated: When consciousness does not appear, the appearance of the object does not occur.

analyzed: iti saṃvid vivarta tvam prapañcaḥ sphuṭam añcati
translated: Thus the manifestation of consciousness clearly appears as the world.

analyzed: atra nirasanīya mata anuvādaḥ saha upalambha niyamāḥ dityādinā
translated: Here, the doctrine to be refuted is stated from because of the rule of simultaneous apprehension onwards.

original: arthaprakāśe niyamena saṃvido bhānāsiddhyarthaṃ tasyāḥ svaprakāśatvamāha yadetaditi /
analyzed: artha prakāśe niyamena saṃvidaḥ bhāna asiddhi artham tasyāḥ sva prakāśa tvam āha yat etat iti
translated: To prove the non-establishment of the appearance of consciousness when there is the appearance of an object, he says that which is this in order to state that it is self-luminous.

original: svayamprakāśatāpravṛttinimittakaḥ śabdo yasya tat svayaṃprakāśatāśabdaṃ svayaṃprakāśaśabdavācyam /
analyzed: svayamprakāśa tā pravṛtti nimittakaḥ śabdaḥ yasya tat svayaṃprakāśa tā śabdam svayamprakāśa śabda vācyam
translated: That which has the word 'self-luminosity' as its name, which is the word for self-luminosity, is the word whose cause of operation is self-luminosity.

analyzed: anena saha upalambha niyamaḥ siddhaḥ
translated: By this, the rule of simultaneous apprehension is established.

analyzed: yasmin n iti
translated: In which,

original: saṃvitprakāśābhāver'thasyāpi na prakāśa iti saṃvitprakāśābhāvavyāpakābhāvapratiyogiprakāśasyārthasya saṃvidananyatvaṃ sidhyati /
analyzed: saṃvid prakāśa abhāvāt ṛthasya api na prakāśaḥ iti saṃvid prakāśa abhāva vyāpaka abhāva pratiyogi prakāśasya arthasya saṃvid ananya tvam sidhyati
translated: in the absence of the light of consciousness, the object also does not shine, the light of the object, which is the counter-correlate of the absence that pervades the absence of the light of consciousness, is established as non-different from consciousness.

analyzed: bimba aprakośe prakāśamānasya pratibambasya iva bimba ananyatvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is non-different from the object, like a reflection that does not shine in the absence of the light of the object.

analyzed: a bhāsamānaḥ iti
translated: Not shining,

analyzed: ātmā jñātā artha jñeyam
translated: the self is the knower, the object is the knowable.

The manifestation of consciousness is the manifestation of consciousness as the object of superimposition on the substratum of consciousness. The world is the manifestation of the known and the knower.

analyzed: añjaticchati
translated: It moves, it cuts.

analyzed: prāpnoti iti yāvat
translated: It reaches, that is the meaning.

analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna sattā atirikta sattā śūnyatva lakṣaṇam saṃvid ananyatvam prapañcasya vivakṣitam
translated: The non-difference of the world from consciousness, characterized by the absence of existence apart from the existence of the substratum, is intended.

analyzed: nīla pīta ādi bāhya kāraḥ vāsanā kalpitaḥ jñāne iti yoga ācāra pakṣaḥ
translated: The Yogacara view is that the external objects such as blue, yellow, etc. are imagined by dispositions in cognition.

analyzed: nīla apīta ādi arthaḥ vidyā kalpitaḥ tatra iti māyi pakṣaḥ ca bodhyam
translated: It should be understood that the view of the Mādhyamikas, according to which the object of cognition is not different from consciousness, is also intended to be refuted here.

analyzed: saṃrakṣyamāṇa bhedāḥ te na anumāna anuvartinaḥ
translated: They are protected by the difference, they do not follow inference.

analyzed: etad pakṣam pratikṣipati mā eva m ityādinā
translated: He rejects this view with Not so and so on.

analyzed: evam jñātṛ jñeya lakṣaṇa arthāt mā sma paribhavaḥ
translated: Do not despise the objects characterized by the knower and the known in this way.

analyzed: na pratikṣipeḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: do not reject them.

analyzed: pratikṣepa īṣām kutas na ghaṭate
translated: Why do you not accept the rejections?

analyzed: tatra āha pratyakṣeṇa iti
translated: There he says by perception.

original: balavattarapratyakṣapramāṇasaṃrakṣyamāṇā ete na tvadīyasaṃvidaikyānumānānuvartino jñātṛjñeyabhedā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: balavattara pratyakṣa pramāṇa saṃrakṣyamāṇāḥ ete na tvadīya saṃvid aikya anumāna anuvartinaḥ jñātṛ jñeya bhedāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that these differences between the knower and the known are protected by the stronger perception, they do not follow your inference of the unity of consciousness.

analyzed: balīyaḥ tvam ca pratyakṣasya upajīvya tvena
translated: And the strength of perception is due to its being the basis of all other means of knowledge.

original: artheṣu saṃvidaikyasādhanārthaṃ hi arthānāṃ saṃvidaśca svarūpagrahaṇaṃ tāvadapekṣitam /
analyzed: artheṣu saṃvid aikya sādhana artham hi arthānām saṃvidaḥ ca svarūpa grahaṇam tāvat apekṣitam
translated: For the purpose of proving the unity of consciousness in objects, it is first necessary to grasp the nature of the objects and consciousness.

original: tata eva ca mithasteṣāṃ bhedo 'pi siddha iti pratyakṣabādhitamanumānaṃ na pravartata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas eva ca mithas teṣām siddhaḥ iti pratyakṣa bādhitam anumānam na pravartate iti arthaḥ
translated: And from that itself, the difference between them is also established. The meaning is that inference, contradicted by perception, does not operate.

analyzed: atra jvālā bheda anumāna vaiṣamya prakāraḥ vivṛtaḥ ātma siddhau
translated: Here, the way in which the inference of the difference of flames is not similar is explained in the Atmasiddhi (Proof of the Self).

analyzed: tatas eva anusandheyaḥ
translated: Therefore, it should be understood from that itself.

analyzed: tathā hi idam aham vedmi iti anyonya anātmanā sphuṭam
translated: For thus, I know this is clearly manifested by mutual non-self.

analyzed: trayam sākṣāt cākā asti iti sa ḍharveṣām ātma sākṣikam
translated: The three are directly perceived, so all things have the self as their witness.

analyzed: tathā hi ti
translated: Thus indeed.
By mutual non-self, by being different from each other.
The three things characterized by the knower, the knowable, and knowledge.

original: atra śrīparaśarabhaṭṭāryaśrīsūktiranusandheyā ahamidamabhivedmītyātmabittyorvibhede sphurati yadi tadaikyaṃ bāhyamapyekamastu /
analyzed: atra śrī paraśara bhaṭṭārya śrī su uktiḥ anusandheyā aham idam abhivedmi iti ātma bittyoḥ vibhede sphurati yadi tat aikyam bāhyam api ekam astu
translated: Here, the statement of the illustrious Parashara Bhattaraka should be understood: If the difference between the self and the known shines forth in 'I know this', then let external things also be one.

original: pramitirapi mṛṣā syātanmeyamithyātvavāde yadi tadapi saheran dīrdhamasmanmatāyuḥ iti // //
analyzed: pramitiḥ api mṛṣā syāt tad meya mithyātva vāde yadi tat api saheran dīrdham asmad mata āyuḥ iti
translated: If even that is accepted in the doctrine of the falsity of the knowable, then let the life of our doctrine be long.

analyzed: pratyakṣa pratipaśram ca na anumānam pravartate
translated: And inference does not operate against direct perception.

analyzed: na hi vahneḥ anuṣṇa tvam dravya tvāt anumīyate  /
translated: For the coldness of fire is not inferred from its being a substance.

analyzed: pratyakṣā iti
translated: By direct perception.

analyzed: pratipakṣam viruddham
translated: Against, i.e., in contradiction with.

original: vahneranuṣṇatvānumānamiva pratyakṣabādhitamarthajñātroḥ saṃvidaikyānumānaṃ bhavadīyamiti proktaṃ bhavati // //
analyzed: vahneḥ anuṣṇa tva anumānam iva pratyakṣa bādhitam artha jñātroḥ saṃvid aikya anumānam bhavadīyam iti proktam bhavati
translated: Your inference of the oneness of consciousness between the object and the knower is said to be contradicted by direct perception, like the inference of the coldness of fire.

analyzed: kiñca hetuḥ viruddhaḥ yam sahabhāvaḥ dvayoḥ yatas
translated: Moreover, this reason is contradictory, because the coexistence of two [things] is not accepted even by you.

original: tavāpi na hi saṃvittiḥ svātmanā saha bhāsate // //
analyzed: tava api na hi saṃvittiḥ sva ātmanā saha bhāsate  /
translated: For you also do not accept that consciousness appears together with itself.

original: kañci sāhityaṃ bhedaniyataṃ jñānārthayorhetughaṭakaṃ tadabhedasādhane viruddhamityāha kiñce ti /
analyzed: sāhityam bheda niyatam jñāna arthayoḥ hetu ghaṭakam tad abheda sādhane viruddham iti āha kiñca iti
translated: And the coexistence of knowledge and object, which is restricted by difference, is a component of the reason, and is contradictory in proving their non-difference. He says Moreover and so on.

original: saṃvitsaṃvidā sahopalabhyata iti hi tavāpi na sammatam /
analyzed: saṃvid saṃvidā saha upalabhyate iti hi tava api na sammatam
translated: For you also do not accept that consciousness is perceived together with consciousness.

original: tatsaṃvidā tatsaṃvidā sahopalabhyamānamarthajātaṃ niyamena tadbhinnameva bhavediti yāvat // //
analyzed: tad saṃvidā tad saṃvidā saha upalabhyamānam artha jātam niyamena tad bhinnam eva bhavet iti yāvat
translated: The class of objects that is perceived together with that consciousness would necessarily be different from it alone, that is the extent of it.
The continuum of pure consciousness, free from the superimposition of blue etc.,

analyzed: svāpa ādau bhāsate
translated: appears in sleep and so on.

analyzed: na evam arthaḥ saṃvedanāt pṛthak
translated: The object is not like this, separate from consciousness.

analyzed: tena saṃvedanam satyam saṃvedyaḥ arthaḥ tu asān iti
translated: Therefore, consciousness is true, but the object of consciousness is unreal.

analyzed: atra śaṅkate nīla ādi upaplave ti
translated: Here he doubts in the superimposition of blue etc.

analyzed: artha uparāgam antarā jñānam bhāsate svāpa ādau
translated: Knowledge appears in sleep and so on without the superimposition of objects.

analyzed: na evam arthaḥ jñānāt vinā kadāpi bhāsate
translated: The object never appears without knowledge.

analyzed: tad pratibimbasya iva artha jātasya mithyātvam saṃvidi kalpitasya iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The class of objects, like a reflected image, is unreal in consciousness, imagined. This is the idea.

analyzed: tat etat aparāmṛṣṭa sva vāc bādhasya jalpitam
translated: This is the talk of one who has not considered the contradiction of his own words.

analyzed: saha upalambha niyamaḥ yena evam sati hīyate  /
translated: By which, if it is so, the rule of simultaneous apprehension is violated.

analyzed: pariharati tat etat iti
translated: He replies: This is...

original: arthaṃ vinā saṃvido bhāne tāṃ vinār'thasyāpi bhānaṃ siddhiprāyamiti sahopalambhanirūpabhavaduktahetvasiddhiriti
analyzed: artham vinā saṃvidaḥ bhāne tām vinā arthasya api bhānam siddhi prāyam iti saha upalambha nirūpa bhavat ukta hetu asiddhiḥ iti
translated: If consciousness shines without an object, and if the object also shines without consciousness, it is almost established. Thus, the reason stated by you, the rule of simultaneous apprehension, is not established.

original: pūrvāparasvavacanavirodhamapi na parāmṛṣṭavān bhavānevaṃvadanniti yāvat // //🔽yasmādṛte yadābhāti bhāti yata
analyzed: pūrva apara sva vacana virodham api na parāmṛṣṭavān bhavān evam vadan iti yāvat  yasmāt ṛte yat ābhāti bhāti yata
translated: You, who speak thus, have not even considered the contradiction between your own earlier and later statements. This is the extent of it.🔽From which, when it shines, it shines

analyzed: smāt ṛte pi tat
translated: from which, even without it, that

analyzed: ghaṭāt ṛte nirbhātaḥ paṭāt iva ghaṭaḥ svayam
translated: the pot shines by itself, like the cloth, even without the pot.

analyzed: iti cit advaita nirāsena miti mātṛ meya bhidā āyāthārthya samarthanam
translated: Thus, by refuting the non-duality of consciousness, he establishes the truth of the distinction between the cognizer, cognition, and cognized.

analyzed: etāvān eva saṃvid tiddhi bhāgaḥ upalabhyate
translated: Only this much of the part of the establishment of consciousness is perceived.

analyzed: iti śrīmat viśiṣṭa advaita siddhānta pravartana dhurandhara parama ācārya śrīmat bhagavat yāmuna muni samanugahīte siddhitraye saṃvid siddhiḥ
translated: Thus ends the Establishment of Consciousness in the three treatises favored by the great teacher, the revered Yamuna Muni, who bears the burden of propagating the doctrine of the distinguished non-dualism.

analyzed: hetu asiddhim eva upapādayati yasmāt iti
translated: He explains the non-establishment of the reason: From which, etc.

analyzed: nirbhātaḥ iti śatṛ antāt pañcamī
translated: The ablative case is from the word nirbhāta.

analyzed: nirbhātāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: when the sun has risen.

original: ghaṭādṛte bhātātatpaṭādṛte bhānaṃ ghaṭasya yathā sidhyati /
analyzed: ghaṭāt ṛte bhātā a tad paṭāt ṛte bhānam ghaṭasya yathā sidhyati
translated: Just as the manifestation of the pot is established as occurring apart from the cloth,

original: tathār'thaṃ vinābhātājjñānādvinā bhānasarthasya sidhyatīti sahopalambhaniyamo nanīladitaddhiyāṃ sidhyatītyarthaḥ /🔽nanu jñānenaivārthaprakāśasya vācyatvājjñānasya ca svaprakāśatvājjñānabhānaṃ vinārṃ'thabhānaṃ
analyzed: tathā artham vinā ābhātāt jñānāt vinā bhānaḥ arthasya sidhyati iti saha upalambha niyamaḥ sidhyati iti arthaḥ  nanu jñānena eva artha prakāśasya vācya tvāt jñānasya ca sva prakāśa tvāt jñāna bhānam vinā arṃtha bhānam
translated: in the same way, the manifestation of the object is established as occurring apart from the manifestation of the cognition. Thus, the rule of simultaneous apprehension is not established for the cognition of blue and that cognition itself.

original: na yujyata iti cedevamapi sahopalambhaniyamo na yujyata eva jñānaviśeṣeṇa jñānasāmānyena vā /
analyzed: na yujyate iti ced evam api saha upalambha niyamaḥ na yujyate eva jñāna viśeṣeṇa jñāna sāmānyena vā
translated: If it is argued that since the illumination of the object by cognition must be stated, and since cognition is self-luminous, the illumination of the object is not possible without the illumination of cognition, even so, the rule of simultaneous apprehension is not possible, either by a particular cognition or by the universal of cognition.

analyzed: pūrvatra vyabhicārāt uttaratra para mate
translated: In the former case, there is deviation; in the latter case, it is not established according to the opponent's view.

original: idamartha eva sahopalambhaniyama iti tamaḥ ślokaḥ /
analyzed: idam arthaḥ eva saha upalambha niyamaḥ iti tamaḥ ślokaḥ
translated: This very rule of simultaneous apprehension is stated in the verse on darkness.

analyzed: sa ca atra anusandheyaḥ iti prāk eva uktam
translated: And that should be connected here. This was stated earlier.

original: evaṃ mitimātṛmeyabhidāyāthātmyaṃ na nihnotuṃ śakyata iti vyavasthāpi tamatreti dhyeyam // //
analyzed: evam miti mātṛ meya bhidā yāthātmyam na nihnotum śakyate iti vyavasthāpi tam atrā iti dhyeyam  /
translated: Thus, the distinction between the cognizer, the cognized, and the cognition cannot be denied. Therefore, the rule should be understood in this way.

analyzed: grantha bhāgaḥ grimaḥ kvāpi samupalabhyate
translated: The next part of the text is not found anywhere else.

analyzed: vyākhyānam vihitam yāvat upalabdhasya sārataḥ
translated: The commentary has been written as far as the essence of what is perceived is concerned.🔽The excellent guru, a mine of knowledge, who has taken birth in the lineage of the author of the commentary, who is skilled in elucidating the meaning of the commentary,

original: prajñānidhirguruvaro mama bhūtapuryāṃ rāmānujārya urukīrtīrayaṃ samindhe //🔽tatpādapaṅkajaniṣevaṇalabdhabodhaḥ kṛṣṇāryasaṃjñagurutātapadāśrito 'ham /🔽aṇṇaṅgarārya iti ca prathitābhidhāno vyākhyābhimāmakaravaṃ prativādibhīkṛta gurupādaprasādena yāmunoktyarṇave tariḥ /
analyzed: prajñā nidhiḥ guru varaḥ mama bhūta puryām rāmānuja āryaḥ uru kīrtīḥ ayam samindhe  tad pāda paṅkaja niṣevaṇa labdha bodhaḥ kṛṣṇa ārya saṃjña guru tāta pada āśritaḥ ham  iti ca prathita abhidhānaḥ vyākhyā abhimām akaravam guru pāda prasādena yāmunā ukti arṇave tariḥ
translated: Ramaanuja, whose fame is great, kindles this [commentary] in my city of birth.🔽Having attained understanding by serving his feet, I, who have taken refuge at the feet of the father guru known as Krishnaarya,🔽whose name is renowned as Annagararya, have composed this commentary, terrifying the opponents.

analyzed: vyakhyeyam vihitā ramyā tuṣṭaye guru pādayoḥ
translated: The beautiful commentary has been composed for the satisfaction of the feet of the guru.

analyzed: yadi atra tu guṇāḥ kecid te tu ācārya prasāda jāḥ
translated: If there are any good qualities here, they are born from the grace of the teacher.

original: māmakīnāḥ punardeṣā iti dhyeyaṃ vivekibhiḥ //🔽vacaḥ kusumahāro 'yaṃ śrīvakṣasi samarpyate /
analyzed: māmakīnāḥ punar deṣāḥ iti dhyeyam vivekibhiḥ  vacaḥ kusuma hāraḥ yam śrī vakṣasi samarpyate
translated: But my faults should be considered by the discerning ones.🔽This garland of flower-like words is offered at the glorious chest [of the guru].

analyzed: lakṣmīnārāyaṇaḥ nena prīyatām puruṣottamaḥ
translated: May Lakshmi Narayana, the Supreme Being, be pleased by this.

analyzed: ṛtu vyoma kha netrā
translated: The eyes of the sky of the seasons,

analyzed: ṅke vaikrame bde kṛtiḥ tu iyam
translated: This work was done in the Vikrama year, in the lap [of my wife].

analyzed: āṣāḍha paurṇamāsyām saṃpūrṇā vṛtta ālaye pure
translated: On the full moon day of Āṣāḍha, in the city of Vṛttāla,

original: iti śrīnagapurī tirunāṅgūra🔽divyadeśābhijanena prativādibhayaṅkarācāryānvaya 🔽bhūṣaṇāvidvadvarya śrīkṛṣṇamācāryākhyācāryavaryarutraratrena catustantrīpā
analyzed: iti śrī nagapurī tirunāṅgūra  divya deśa abhijanena prativādi bhayaṅkara ācārya anvaya  bhūṣaṇā vidvas varya śrīkṛṣṇam ācārya ākhya ācārya varya rutra ratrena catur tantrīpā
translated: Thus, in the city of Nagapuri, Tirunangur,🔽The ornament of the lineage of the fearsome debater, the learned one,🔽The great teacher named Krishnamacharya, who has crossed to the other shore of the four strings,
The embodiment of compassion and fame that has spread to the ends of the directions, the illustrious commentator,
The learned one who delights in residing in the city of Bhutapuri, which is descended from the divine lineage,

analyzed: bhoma hārīta śrī madā sūri rāmānuja ācārya deśi
translated: The teacher Ramanuja Acharya, the illustrious Asurisha Hari, who is the lord of all the learned,

analyzed: ka indra caraṇa kamala varivasya asam adhigata pada vākya
translated: Who has attained the state of the words and sentences through serving the lotus feet of the venerable Kandra,
The one who has understood the essence of the Pramana Tantra, the illustrious Vaishnava Dasa,

analyzed: aṇṇaṅgara ācāryeṇa
translated: The one who has mastered both Nyaya and grammar,

analyzed: śiromaṇinā ubhaya vedānta viduṣā
translated: The learned one in both the Vedas,🔽The commentary on the Siddhanta that has been completed,

analyzed: siddhāñjanam saṃpūrṇam
translated: The ointment of success,

analyzed: vijayata antamām
translated: May it be victorious forever.
